MiniHoTT Library

Intro.lagda

layout: page title: ‚ÄúIntroduction‚Äù toc: true agda: true gallery: true latex: true references: false linkify: true showcitation: true ‚Äî

Mini-HoTT is a basic library for Homotopy Type Theory in Agda developed at University of Bergen in the Programming Theory Research Group.

No other libraries are required to use this Agda library. To ease its adoption, we have included synonyms and syntax sugar for types, lemmas, and theorems. Regarding performance, we would recommend to check out another option like the HoTT-Agda library. We encourage to check the references at the end of this documment, which might contain better explanation of our exposition.

Quick start

Installation

  • Install Agda (v2.6.0+)

  • Clone this repository http://github.com/jonaprieto/mini-hott with:

    • git clone http://github.com/jonaprieto/mini-hott

  • Or install the library in ~/.agda or even better, use agda-pkg as follows:

    • pip install agda-pkg
    • apkg install mini-hott (not indexed at the moment until it‚Äôs more stable)

  • Use the library by including the following import at the top of your source code:

    • open import MiniHoTT

Code style

Definitions and theorems are typed with unicode characters, this to improve significantly the readability. We usually present lemmas and theorems as rule inferences as in the following example. Level universes are now included in each definition, this apparently improves the time for type-checking.

termName
  :  ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ.. : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}   -- Implicit Assumptions
  ‚Üí (B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)                    -- Explicit Assumptions
  ‚Üí ...                                  -- Explicit Assumptions
  ---------------------
  ‚Üí ...                                  -- Conclusion

On the website, we show the type for each term but some term definitions are hidden. However, you can expand them by clicking on the code boxes ‚Äìthis requires Javascript‚Äì.

termName = definition
  where
  helper1 : ...
  helper2 = def...

Proof relevancy

To be consistent with Univalent Type Theory, we tell Agda to not use Axiom K for type-checking by using the option without-K.

{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}

In addition, without Axiom K, Agda‚Äôs Set is not a good name for universes in HoTT. So, we rename Set to Type. Our type judgments then will include the universe level as one explicit argument.

open import Agda.Primitive
  using ( Level ; lsuc; lzero; _‚äî_ ) public

Note that l ‚äî q is the maximum of two hierarchy levels l and q and we use this later on to define types in full generality.

Type
  : (‚Ñì : Level)
  ‚Üí Set (lsuc ‚Ñì)

Type ‚Ñì = Set ‚Ñì

Type‚ÇÄ
  : Type (lsuc lzero)

Type‚ÇÄ = Type lzero

Type‚ÇÅ
  : Type (lsuc (lsuc lzero))

Type‚ÇÅ = Type (lsuc lzero)

The following type is to lift a type to a higher universe.

record
  ‚Üë {a : Level} ‚Ñì (A : Type a)
    : Type (a ‚äî ‚Ñì)
  where
  constructor Lift
  field
    lower : A

open ‚Üë public

Type theory

Types

Empty type

A datatype without constructors is the empty type. This represents the falsehood.

data
  ùüò (‚Ñì : Level) : Type ‚Ñì
  where
  -- Nothing

Synonyms of ‚ä•:

‚ä•     = ùüò
Empty = ùüò

Its eliminator principle also called Ex falso quodlibet:

exfalso
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí ‚ä• ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ
  --------
  ‚Üí A

exfalso ()

Synonyms of exfalso rule:

Empty-elim = exfalso
‚ä•-elim     = exfalso
ùüò-elim     = exfalso

The negation symbol is a shortcut of an implication for the falsehood.

¬¨ : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì
¬¨ {‚Ñì} A = (A ‚Üí ‚ä• ‚Ñì)

Unit type

The unit type is defined as a record to get also the $Œ∑$-rule definitionally. This type has no elimination rule.

record
  ùüô (‚Ñì : Level)
    : Type ‚Ñì
  where
  constructor unit

-- {-# BUILTIN UNIT ‚ä§ #-}

Synonyms for the Unit type:

Unit = ùüô
‚ä§    = ùüô

Synonyms for the data constructor:

pattern ‚òÖ = unit
pattern ‚àó = unit

‚àë-types

The dependent product is called Sigma types. It‚Äôs the the type for pairs where the second term in the pair may depend on the first term.

record
  ‚àë {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} (A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ)(B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
   : Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
  where
  constructor _,_
  field
    œÄ‚ÇÅ : A
    œÄ‚ÇÇ : B œÄ‚ÇÅ

infixr 60 _,_
open ‚àë public

Symbol synonym:

Œ£ = ‚àë -- \Sigma and \sum

Constructor synonyms:

proj‚ÇÅ = œÄ‚ÇÅ
proj‚ÇÇ = œÄ‚ÇÇ

pr‚ÇÅ   = œÄ‚ÇÅ
pr‚ÇÇ   = œÄ‚ÇÇ

fst   = œÄ‚ÇÅ
snd   = œÄ‚ÇÇ

#     =  œÄ‚ÇÅ

Œ†-types

Œ†
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} (A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ)(B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
  --------------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)

Œ† A B = (x : A) ‚Üí B x

Synonyms

‚àè = Œ†   -- \prod vs \Pi

Products

Product type as a particular case of the Sigma type.

_√ó_
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} (A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ)(B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
  ----------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)

A √ó B = ‚àë A (Œª _ ‚Üí B)

infixl  39 _√ó_

Coproducts

Sum types as inductive types

data
  _+_ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} (A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ)(B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
    : Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
  where
  inl : A ‚Üí A + B
  inr : B ‚Üí A + B

infixr 31 _+_

Constructors synonyms:

-- pattern left  = inl  -- TODO: This is not working as I expected
-- pattern right = inr

The elimination principle:

+-elim
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {C : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
  ‚Üí (A ‚Üí C) ‚Üí (B ‚Üí C)
  -------------------
  ‚Üí (A + B) ‚Üí C

+-elim A‚ÜíC B‚ÜíC (inl x) = A‚ÜíC x
+-elim A‚ÜíC B‚ÜíC (inr x) = B‚ÜíC x

Synonyms:

cases = +-elim

syntax cases f g = ‚ü® f + g ‚ü©

Implications

data
  _‚áí_ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} (A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ)(B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
    : Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
  where
  fun : (A ‚Üí B) ‚Üí A ‚áí B

Bi-implications

_‚áî_
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ
  -------------------
  ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)

A ‚áî B = (A ‚Üí B) √ó (B ‚Üí A)

Synonyms:

_‚Üî_ = _‚áî_

infix 30 _‚Üî_ _‚áî_

Booleans

module _  where
  data
    ùüö (‚Ñì : Level) : Type (lsuc ‚Ñì)
    where
    ùüò‚ÇÇ : ùüö ‚Ñì
    ùüô‚ÇÇ : ùüö ‚Ñì

Synonyms:

Bool = ùüö lzero

Constructors synonyms:

false : ùüö lzero
false = ùüò‚ÇÇ

true : ùüö lzero
true  = ùüô‚ÇÇ

ff = false
tt = true

Natural numbers

data
  ‚Ñï : Type lzero
  where
  zero : ‚Ñï
  succ : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï

Synonyms for natural numbers

Nat = ‚Ñï

pattern zr = zero
pattern sc = succ

{-# BUILTIN NATURAL ‚Ñï #-}

An order relation will use in the following type constructor.

module ‚Ñï-< {‚Ñì : Level} where
  _<_ :  ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì
  zero   < zero   = ‚ä• ‚Ñì
  zero   < succ b = ‚ä§ ‚Ñì
  succ _ < zero   = ‚ä• ‚Ñì
  succ a < succ b = a < b

and we can state the relation $\geq$ as as shortcut for‚Ä¶

  _>_ : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì
  a > b = b < a

Finite sets

A finite set can be define in so many ways. We opt to use a ‚àë-type which we believe is clear enough to say what they are. A finite set of $n : \mathsf{N}$, $\mathsf{Fin}_{n}$, is the collection of numbers less ($<$) than the number $n$. This notion is the following type family.

module Fin (‚Ñì : Level) where
  mutual
    Fin : ‚Ñï ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì
    Fin n = Œ£ (‚Ñï) (Œª m ‚Üí m < n)
    open ‚Ñï-< {‚Ñì}

Even though, there are other approaches to define finite sets, (in the standard-library in Agda, they have defined inductively fin sets as with natural numbers.)

module _ {‚Ñì : Level} where
  ‚ü¶_‚üß : ‚Ñï ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì
  ‚ü¶_‚üß zero  = ùüò ‚Ñì
  ‚ü¶_‚üß (succ n)  = ùüô ‚Ñì + ‚ü¶ n ‚üß

In math books, we denote by the finite set of $n$ as $[n]$, we mimic this notation as follows:

Synomym:

  Fin‚ÇÇ = ‚ü¶_‚üß

Without going further, it‚Äôs natural to define two essential functions: successor, and predecessor.

Succesor function on (finite) natural numbers are well-defined when we consider sets with at least one element.

  • $1 :‚â° inl unit$

  • $n :‚â° inr (inr ‚Ä¶)$

  ‚ü¶‚üß-succ
    : {n : ‚Ñï}
    ‚Üí ‚ü¶ n ‚üß ‚Üí ‚ü¶ succ n ‚üß

  ‚ü¶‚üß-succ {succ n} (inl x) = inr (inl unit)
  ‚ü¶‚üß-succ {succ n} (inr x) = inr (‚ü¶‚üß-succ x)

  ‚ü¶‚üß-pred
    : ‚àÄ (n : ‚Ñï)
    ‚Üí ‚ü¶ n ‚üß ‚Üí  ‚ü¶ n ‚üß -- clarify why in succ?,

  ‚ü¶‚üß-pred (succ n) (inl x) = inl x
  ‚ü¶‚üß-pred (succ n) (inr x) = inr (‚ü¶‚üß-pred n x)

Equalities

In HoTT, we have a different interpretation of type theory in which the set-theoretical notion of sets for types is replaced by the topological notion of spaces.

The (homogeneous) equality type also called identity type is considered a primary type (included in the theory by default). To form this type, we fix a type A and a term a : A, to have the identity type a == a, also denoted by Id(a,a) or a‚áùa. We only have one constructor of these types called idp or sometimes refl. To use identity types, we have below the J-eliminator.

data
  _==_ {‚Ñì : Level}{A : Type ‚Ñì} (a : A)
    : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì
  where
  idp : a == a

-- synonyms for the identity type
Eq   = _==_
Id   = _==_
Path = _==_
_‚áù_  = _==_   -- '\r~'
_‚â°_  = _==_   -- '\equiv' (may be not good idea...)

infix 30 _==_ _‚áù_ _‚â°_

{-# BUILTIN EQUALITY _==_  #-}

refl
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì}
  ‚Üí (a : A)
  -----------------
  ‚Üí a == a

refl  a = idp

Symmetry property for the identity types.

sym
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì} {x y : A}
  ‚Üí x == y
  --------
  ‚Üí y == x

sym idp = idp

syntax sym p = ‚àí p

To work with identity types, we have its induction principle as the J-eliminator.

Paulin-Mohring J rule

J
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì}  {a : A} {‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level}
  ‚Üí (B : (a' : A) (p : a == a') ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
  ‚Üí (d : B a idp)
  ----------------------------------------
  ‚Üí {a' : A} (p : a == a') ‚Üí B a' p

J {a = a} B d idp = d

J'
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì}  {a : A} {‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level}
  ‚Üí (B : (a' : A) (p : a' == a) ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
  ‚Üí (d : B a idp)
  ----------------------------------------
  ‚Üí {a' : A} (p : a' == a) ‚Üí B a' p

J' {a = a} B d idp = d

Decidable type

data
  Dec {‚Ñì : Level}(P : Type ‚Ñì)
    : Type ‚Ñì
  where
  yes : ( p : P) ‚Üí Dec P
  no  : (¬¨p : P ‚Üí ‚ä• ‚Ñì) ‚Üí Dec P

‚åä_‚åã : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level}{P : Type ‚Ñì} ‚Üí Dec P ‚Üí ùüö ‚Ñì
‚åä yes _ ‚åã = ùüô‚ÇÇ
‚åä no  _ ‚åã = ùüò‚ÇÇ

REL
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level}
  ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì
  ----------------
  ‚Üí Type (lsuc ‚Ñì)

REL {‚Ñì} A B = A ‚Üí B ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì

Decidable
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A B : Type ‚Ñì}
  ‚Üí REL A B
  ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì

Decidable _‚àº_ = ‚àÄ x y ‚Üí Dec (x ‚àº y)

BasicFunctions.lagda

{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}

Basic functions

Identity functions

The identity function with implicit type.

id
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì}
  ----------------
  ‚Üí A ‚Üí A

id = Œª x ‚Üí x

identity = id

The identity function on a type A is idf A.

idf
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} (A : Type ‚Ñì)
  ---------------
  ‚Üí (A ‚Üí A)

idf A = Œª x ‚Üí x

Constant functions

Constant function at some point b is cst b

cst
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí (b : B)
  ---------
  ‚Üí (A ‚Üí B)

cst b = Œª _ ‚Üí b

constant = cst

Logical negation

neg¬¨
  : Bool
  ‚Üí Bool

neg¬¨ tt = ff

Composition

A more sophisticated composition function that can handle dependent functions.

_‚àò_
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {C : (a : A) ‚Üí (B a ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ)}
  ‚Üí (g : {a : A} ‚Üí ‚àè (B a) (C a))
  ‚Üí (f : ‚àè A B)
  -------------------------------
  ‚Üí ‚àè A (Œª a ‚Üí C a (f a))

g ‚àò f = Œª x ‚Üí g (f x)

infixr 80 _‚àò_

Synonym for composition (diagrammatic version)

_:>_
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {C : (a : A) ‚Üí (B a ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ)}
  ‚Üí (f : Œ† A B)
  ‚Üí (g : {a : A} ‚Üí Œ† (B a) (C a))
  -------------------------------
  ‚Üí Œ† A (Œª a ‚Üí C a (f a))

f :> g = g ‚àò f

infixr 90 _:>_

Associativity of composition

  • Left associativity
‚àò-lassoc
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A B C D : Type ‚Ñì}
  ‚Üí (h : C ‚Üí D) ‚Üí (g : B ‚Üí C) ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
  -----------------------------------------
  ‚Üí (h ‚àò (g ‚àò f)) == ((h ‚àò g) ‚àò f)

‚àò-lassoc h g f = idp {a = (Œª x ‚Üí h (g (f x)))}
  • Right associativity
‚àò-rassoc
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A B C D : Type ‚Ñì}
  ‚Üí (h : C ‚Üí D) ‚Üí (g : B ‚Üí C) ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
  -----------------------------------------
  ‚Üí ((h ‚àò g) ‚àò f) == (h ‚àò (g ‚àò f))

‚àò-rassoc h g f = sym (‚àò-lassoc h g f)

Application

_‚Üê_ : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} (A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ) (B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ) ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
B ‚Üê A = A ‚Üí B

_$_
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí (‚àÄ (x : A) ‚Üí B x)
  -------------
  ‚Üí (‚àÄ (x : A) ‚Üí B x)

f $ x = f x

infixr 0 _$_

Coproduct manipulation

Functions handy to manipulate coproducts:

+-map
  : ‚àÄ {i j k l : Level} {A : Type i} {B : Type j} {A' : Type k} {B' : Type l}
  ‚Üí (A ‚Üí A')
  ‚Üí (B ‚Üí B')
  ‚Üí A + B ‚Üí A' + B'

+-map f g = cases (f :> inl) (g :> inr)

syntax +-map f g = ‚å© f ‚äï g ‚å™

parallell
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {C : (a : A) ‚Üí (B a ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ)}
  ‚Üí (f : (a : A) ‚Üí B a)
  ‚Üí ((a : A) ‚Üí C a (f a))
  -------------------------
  ‚Üí (a : A) ‚Üí ‚àë (B a) (C a)

parallell f g a = (f a , g a)

syntax parallell f g = ‚å© f √ó g ‚å™

Curryfication

curry
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}  {C : Œ£ A B ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
  ‚Üí ((s : ‚àë A B) ‚Üí C s)
  -------------------------------
  ‚Üí ((x : A)(y : B x) ‚Üí C (x , y))

curry f x y = f (x , y)

Uncurryfication

unCurry
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {C : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
  ‚Üí (D : (a : A) ‚Üí B a ‚Üí C)
  ------------------------
  ‚Üí (p : ‚àë A B) ‚Üí C

unCurry D p = D (proj‚ÇÅ p) (proj‚ÇÇ p)

uncurry
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {C : (a : A) ‚Üí (B a ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ)}
  ‚Üí (f : (a : A) (b : B a) ‚Üí C a b)
  ---------------------------------
  ‚Üí (p : ‚àë A B) ‚Üí C (œÄ‚ÇÅ p) (œÄ‚ÇÇ p)

uncurry f (x , y) = f x y

Heterogeneous equality

data
  HEq {‚Ñì : Level} (A : Type ‚Ñì)
    : (B : Type ‚Ñì)
    ‚Üí (Œ± : A == B) (a : A) (b : B)
    ‚Üí Type (lsuc ‚Ñì)
  where
  idp : {a : A} ‚Üí HEq A A idp a a

Path functions

Composition of paths

_¬∑_
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì}  {x y z : A}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ‚Üí (q : y == z)
  --------------
  ‚Üí x == z

_¬∑_ idp q = q

infixl 50 _¬∑_

Inverse of paths

inv
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì}  {a b : A}
  ‚Üí a == b
  --------
  ‚Üí b == a

inv idp = idp

Synonyms for inverse path

_‚Åª¬π = inv
!_  = inv

infixl 60 _‚Åª¬π !_

Equational reasoning

Equational reasoning is a way to write readable chains of equalities like in the following proof.

  t : a ‚â° e
  t =
    begin
      a ‚â°‚ü® p ‚ü©
      b ‚â°‚ü® q ‚ü©
      c ‚â°‚ü® r ‚ü©
      d ‚â°‚ü® s ‚ü©
      e
    ‚àé

where p is a path from a to b, q is a path from b to c, and so on.

module
  EquationalReasoning {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì}
  where

Definitional equals:

  _==‚ü®‚ü©_
    : ‚àÄ (x {y} : A)
    -----------------
    ‚Üí x == y ‚Üí x == y

  _ ==‚ü®‚ü© p = p

Synonyms:

  _==‚ü®idp‚ü©_  = _==‚ü®‚ü©_
  _==‚ü®refl‚ü©_ = _==‚ü®‚ü©_
  _‚â°‚ü®‚ü©_      = _==‚ü®‚ü©_

  infixr 2 _==‚ü®‚ü©_ _==‚ü®idp‚ü©_ _==‚ü®refl‚ü©_ _‚â°‚ü®‚ü©_

Chain:

  _==‚ü®_‚ü©_
    : (x : A) {y z : A}
    ‚Üí x == y
    ‚Üí y == z
    --------
    ‚Üí x == z

  _ ==‚ü® thm ‚ü© q = thm ¬∑ q

Synomyms:

  _‚â°‚ü®_‚ü©_ = _==‚ü®_‚ü©_

  infixr 2 _==‚ü®_‚ü©_ _‚â°‚ü®_‚ü©_

Q.E.D:

  _‚àé
    : (x : A)
    ‚Üí x == x

  _‚àé = Œª x ‚Üí idp

  infix 3 _‚àé

The begining of a proof:

  begin_
    : {x y : A}
    ‚Üí x == y
    ‚Üí x == y

  begin_ p = p

  infix 1 begin_

open EquationalReasoning public

AlgebraOnPaths.lagda

layout: page title: ‚ÄúAlgebra On Paths‚Äù category: lemmas functions toc: true agda: true gallery: true latex: true references: false linkify: true showcitation: true ‚Äî

{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}
open import BasicTypes public
open import BasicFunctions public

Algebra of paths

ap
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B) {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A}
  ‚Üí a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ
  --------------
  ‚Üí f a‚ÇÅ == f a‚ÇÇ

ap f idp = idp

Synonyms:

cong  = ap
app-‚â° = ap

syntax app-‚â° f p = f [[ p ]]

Now, we can define a convenient syntax sugar for ap in equational reasoning.

infixl 40 ap
syntax ap f p = p |in-ctx f

Let‚Äôs suppose we have a lemma:

  lemma : a ‚â° b
  lemma = _

used in an equational reasoning like:

  t : a ‚â° e
  t = f a ‚â°‚ü® ap f lemma ‚ü©
      f b
      ‚àé

Then, we can now put the lemma in front:

  t : a == e
  t = f a =‚ü® lemma |in-ctx f ‚ü©
      f b
      ‚àé

Lastly, we can also define actions on two paths:

ap‚ÇÇ
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {C : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}  {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A} {b‚ÇÅ b‚ÇÇ : B}
  ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B ‚Üí C)
  ‚Üí (a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ) ‚Üí (b‚ÇÅ == b‚ÇÇ)
  --------------------------
  ‚Üí f a‚ÇÅ b‚ÇÅ  == f a‚ÇÇ b‚ÇÇ

ap‚ÇÇ f idp idp = idp

ap-¬∑
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {a b c : A}
  ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B) ‚Üí (p : a == b) ‚Üí (q : b == c)
  -------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí ap f (p ¬∑ q) == ap f p ¬∑ ap f q

ap-¬∑ f idp q = refl (ap f q)

ap-inv
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}  {a b : A}
  ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B) ‚Üí (p : a == b)
  ----------------------------
  ‚Üí ap f (p ‚Åª¬π) == (ap f p) ‚Åª¬π

ap-inv f idp = idp

Synonyms:

ap-! = ap-inv

ap-comp
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {C : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ} {a b : A}
  ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
  ‚Üí (g : B ‚Üí C)
  ‚Üí (p : a == b)
  -------------------------------
  ‚Üí ap g (ap f p) == ap (g ‚àò f) p

ap-comp f g idp = idp

ap-id
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a b : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == b)
  --------------
  ‚Üí ap id p == p

ap-id idp = idp

ap-const
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}  {a a' : A} {b : B}
  ‚Üí (p : a == a')
  -----------------------
  ‚Üí ap (Œª _ ‚Üí b) p == idp

ap-const {b = b} idp = refl (refl b)

Properties on the groupoid

Some properties on the groupoid structure of equalities

¬∑-runit
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì}  {a a' : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == a')
  --------------
  ‚Üí p == p ¬∑ idp

¬∑-runit idp = idp

¬∑-lunit
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì}  {a a' : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == a')
  --------------
  ‚Üí p == idp ¬∑ p

¬∑-lunit idp = idp

¬∑-linv
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì}  {a a' : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == a')
  ----------------
  ‚Üí ! p ¬∑ p == idp

¬∑-linv idp = idp

‚â°-inverse-left = ¬∑-linv

¬∑-rinv
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì}  {a a' : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == a')
  ----------------
  ‚Üí p ¬∑ ! p == idp

¬∑-rinv idp = idp

‚â°-inverse-right  = ¬∑-rinv

involution
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì}  {a a' : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == a')
  ---------------
  ‚Üí ! (! p) == p

involution idp = idp

¬∑-assoc
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a b c d : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == b) ‚Üí (q : b == c) ‚Üí (r : c == d)
  --------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí p ¬∑ q ¬∑ r == p ¬∑ (q ¬∑ r)

¬∑-assoc idp q r = idp

¬∑-cancellation
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == a) ‚Üí (q : a == a) ‚Üí p ¬∑ q == p
  -----------------------------------------
  ‚Üí q == refl a

¬∑-cancellation {a = a} p q Œ± =
    begin
      q             ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ q) (! (¬∑-linv p)) ‚ü©
      ! p ¬∑ p ¬∑ q   ==‚ü® (¬∑-assoc (! p) _ _) ‚ü©
      ! p ¬∑ (p ¬∑ q) ==‚ü® (ap (! p ¬∑_) Œ±) ‚ü©
      ! p ¬∑ p       ==‚ü® ¬∑-linv p ‚ü©
      refl a
    ‚àé

Moving a term from one side to the other is a common task, so let‚Äôs define some handy functions for that.

¬∑-left-to-right-l
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a b c : A} {p : a == b} {q : b == c} {r : a == c}
  ‚Üí p ¬∑ q == r
  ------------------
  ‚Üí     q == ! p ¬∑ r

¬∑-left-to-right-l {a = a}{b = b}{c = c} {p} {q} {r} Œ± =
  begin
    q
      ==‚ü® ¬∑-lunit q ‚ü©
    refl b ¬∑ q
      ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ q) (! (¬∑-linv p)) ‚ü©
    (! p ¬∑ p) ¬∑ q
      ==‚ü® ¬∑-assoc (! p) p q ‚ü©
    ! p ¬∑ (p ¬∑ q)
      ==‚ü® ap (! p ¬∑_) Œ± ‚ü©
    ! p ¬∑ r
  ‚àé

¬∑-left-to-right-r
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a b c : A} {p : a == b} {q : b == c} {r : a == c}
  ‚Üí p ¬∑ q == r
  -------------------
  ‚Üí      p == r ¬∑ ! q

¬∑-left-to-right-r {a = a}{b = b}{c = c} {p} {q} {r} Œ± =
  begin
    p
      ==‚ü® ¬∑-runit p ‚ü©
    p ¬∑ refl b
      ==‚ü® ap (p ¬∑_) (! (¬∑-rinv q)) ‚ü©
    p ¬∑ (q ¬∑ ! q)
      ==‚ü® ! (¬∑-assoc p q (! q)) ‚ü©
    (p ¬∑ q) ¬∑ ! q
      ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ ! q) Œ± ‚ü©
    r ¬∑ ! q
  ‚àé

¬∑-right-to-left-r
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a b c : A} {p : a == c} {q : a == b} {r : b == c}
  ‚Üí       p == q ¬∑ r
  -------------------
  ‚Üí p ¬∑ ! r == q

¬∑-right-to-left-r {a = a}{b = b}{c = c} {p} {q} {r} Œ± =
  begin
    p ¬∑ ! r
      ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ ! r) Œ± ‚ü©
    (q ¬∑ r) ¬∑ ! r
      ==‚ü® ¬∑-assoc q r (! r) ‚ü©
    q ¬∑ (r ¬∑ ! r)
      ==‚ü® ap (q ¬∑_) (¬∑-rinv r) ‚ü©
    q ¬∑ refl b
      ==‚ü® ! (¬∑-runit q) ‚ü©
    q
    ‚àé

¬∑-right-to-left-l
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a b c : A} {p : a == c} {q : a == b} {r : b == c}
  ‚Üí       p == q ¬∑ r
  ------------------
  ‚Üí ! q ¬∑ p == r

¬∑-right-to-left-l {a = a}{b = b}{c = c} {p} {q} {r} Œ± =
  begin
    ! q ¬∑ p
      ==‚ü® ap (! q ¬∑_) Œ± ‚ü©
    ! q ¬∑ (q ¬∑ r)
      ==‚ü® ! (¬∑-assoc (! q) q r) ‚ü©
    ! q ¬∑ q ¬∑ r
      ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ r) (¬∑-linv q) ‚ü©
    refl b ¬∑ r
      ==‚ü® ! (¬∑-lunit r) ‚ü©
    r
  ‚àé

Finally, when we invert a path composition this is what we got.

!-¬∑
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a b : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == b)
  ‚Üí (q : b == a)
  --------------------------
  ‚Üí ! (p ¬∑ q) == ! q ¬∑ ! p

!-¬∑ idp q = ¬∑-runit (! q)

Transport.lagda

{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}

Transport

transport
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}
  ‚Üí (C : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ) {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ)
  -------------------------------
  ‚Üí (C a‚ÇÅ ‚Üí C a‚ÇÇ)

transport C idp = (Œª x ‚Üí x)

-- synonyms
tr     = transport
tr‚ÇÅ    = transport
transp = transport

Coercion

coe
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A B : Type ‚Ñì}
  ‚Üí A == B
  ---------
  ‚Üí (A ‚Üí B)

coe p a = transport (Œª X ‚Üí X) p a

and its inverse:

!coe
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A B : Type ‚Ñì}
  ‚Üí A == B
  ---------
  ‚Üí (B ‚Üí A)

!coe p a = transport (Œª X ‚Üí X) (! p) a

Pathovers

Let be A : Type, a‚ÇÅ, a‚ÇÇ : A, C : A ‚Üí Type, c‚ÇÅ : C a‚ÇÅ and c‚ÇÇ : C a‚ÇÇ. Using the same notation from (Univalent Foundations Program, 2013), one of the definitions for the Pathover type is as the shorthand for the path between the transport along a path Œ± : a‚ÇÅ = a‚ÇÇ of the point c‚ÇÅ : C a‚ÇÅ and the point c‚ÇÇ in the fiber C a‚ÇÇ. That is, a pathover is a term that inhabit the type transport C Œ± c‚ÇÅ = c‚ÇÇ also denoted by PathOver C c‚ÇÅ Œ± c‚ÇÇ.

PathOver
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}
  ‚Üí (B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ) {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A}
  ‚Üí (b‚ÇÅ : B a‚ÇÅ) ‚Üí (Œ± : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ) ‚Üí (b‚ÇÇ : B a‚ÇÇ)
  --------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ

PathOver B b‚ÇÅ Œ± b‚ÇÇ = tr B Œ± b‚ÇÅ == b‚ÇÇ

infix 30 PathOver

syntax PathOver B b‚ÇÅ Œ± b‚ÇÇ  = b‚ÇÅ == b‚ÇÇ [ B ‚Üì Œ± ]

Another notation:

‚â°Over = PathOver

infix 30 ‚â°Over
syntax ‚â°Over B b Œ± b' = b ‚â° b' [ B / Œ± ]

Transport and composition:

tr‚ÇÅ-‚â°
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a‚ÇÄ a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A}
  ‚Üí (Œ± : a‚ÇÅ ‚â° a‚ÇÇ)
  ‚Üí (Œµ : a‚ÇÄ ‚â° a‚ÇÅ)
  ‚Üí (Œ¥ : a‚ÇÄ ‚â° a‚ÇÇ)
  ‚Üí (Œµ ‚â° Œ¥ [ (Œª a' ‚Üí a‚ÇÄ ‚â° a') / Œ± ])
  ----------------------------------
  ‚Üí Œ± ‚â° ! Œµ ¬∑ Œ¥

tr‚ÇÅ-‚â° idp .idp idp idp = idp

Transport along pathovers

tr‚ÇÇ
  :  ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí (C : (a : A) ‚Üí (B a ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ))
  ‚Üí {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A}{b‚ÇÅ : B a‚ÇÅ}{b‚ÇÇ : B a‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí (p : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ)
  ‚Üí (q : b‚ÇÅ == b‚ÇÇ [ B ‚Üì p ])
  ‚Üí C a‚ÇÅ b‚ÇÅ
  -----------------------
  ‚Üí C a‚ÇÇ b‚ÇÇ

tr‚ÇÇ C idp idp = id

-- Gylterud's tr‚ÇÇ-commute
tr‚ÇÇ-commute
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí (C : (a : A) ‚Üí (B a ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ))
  ‚Üí (D : (a : A) ‚Üí (B a ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ))
  ‚Üí (f : ‚àÄ a b ‚Üí C a b ‚Üí D a b)
  ‚Üí ‚àÄ {a a' b b'}
  ‚Üí (p : a ‚â° a')
  ‚Üí (q : b ‚â° b' [ B / p ])
  ‚Üí ‚àÄ c ‚Üí tr‚ÇÇ D p q (f a b c) ‚â° f a' b' (tr‚ÇÇ C p q c)

tr‚ÇÇ-commute C D f idp idp c = idp

TransportLemmas.lagda

layout: page title: ‚ÄúLemmas about transport ‚Äú category: lemmas functions transport toc: true agda: true gallery: true latex: true references: false linkify: true showcitation: true ‚Äî

{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}

Some lemmas on the transport operation

lift
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A} {C : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí (Œ± : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ)
  ‚Üí (u : C a‚ÇÅ)
  -----------------------------
  ‚Üí (a‚ÇÅ , u) == (a‚ÇÇ , tr C Œ± u)

lift {a‚ÇÅ = a‚ÇÅ} idp u = refl (a‚ÇÅ , u)

transport-const
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {a‚ÇÅ  a‚ÇÇ : A} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí (p : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ)
  ‚Üí (b : B)
  -----------------------
  ‚Üí tr (Œª _ ‚Üí B) p b == b

transport-const idp b = refl b

transport-inv-l
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {a a' : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == a')
  ‚Üí (b : P a')
  ----------------------------
  ‚Üí tr P p (tr P (! p) b) == b

transport-inv-l idp b = idp

transport-inv-r
  :  ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}  {a a' : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == a')
  ‚Üí (b : P a)
  --------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí tr P (! p) (tr P p b) == b

transport-inv-r idp _ = idp

-- synonyms
tr-inverse = transport-inv-r

transport-concat-r
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a : A} {x y : A}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ‚Üí (q : a == x)
  ---------------------------------
  ‚Üí tr (Œª x ‚Üí a == x) p q == q ¬∑ p

transport-concat-r idp q = ¬∑-runit q

transport-concat-l
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a : A} {x y : A}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ‚Üí (q : x == a)
  ----------------------------------
  ‚Üí tr (Œª x ‚Üí x == a) p q == ! p ¬∑ q

transport-concat-l idp q = idp

transport-concat
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì} {x y : A}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ‚Üí (q : x == x)
  ---------------------------------------
  ‚Üí tr (Œª x ‚Üí x == x) p q == ! p ¬∑ q ¬∑ p

transport-concat idp q = ¬∑-runit q

b

g<pre class="Agda">n{</pre>o<pre class="Agda">e</pre> transport-eq-fun : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} ‚Üí (f g : A ‚Üí B) {x y : A} ‚Üí (p : x == y) ‚Üí (q : f x == g x) ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äì ‚Üí tr (Œª z ‚Üí f z == g z) p q == ! (ap f p) ¬∑ q ¬∑ (ap g p)

transport-eq-fun f g idp q = ¬∑-runit q


{: .foldable until="6" }

transport-comp : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {a b c : A} {P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} ‚Üí (p : a == b) ‚Üí (q : b == c) ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî ‚Üí ((tr P q) ‚àò (tr P p)) == tr P (p ¬∑ q)

transport-comp {P = P} idp q = refl (transport P q)


{: .foldable until="7" }

transport-comp-h : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {a b c : A} {P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} ‚Üí (p : a == b) ‚Üí (q : b == c) ‚Üí (x : P a) ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî- ‚Üí ((tr P q) ‚àò (tr P p)) x == tr P (p ¬∑ q) x

transport-comp-h {P = P} idp q x = refl (transport P q x)


{: .foldable until="6" }

transport-eq-fun-l : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {b : B} ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B) {x y : A} ‚Üí (p : x == y) ‚Üí (q : f x == b) ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî- ‚Üí tr (Œª z ‚Üí f z == b) p q == ! (ap f p) ¬∑ q

transport-eq-fun-l {b = b} f p q = begin transport (Œª z ‚Üí f z == b) p q ==‚ü® transport-eq-fun f (Œª _ ‚Üí b) p q ‚ü© ! (ap f p) ¬∑ q ¬∑ ap (Œª _ ‚Üí b) p ==‚ü® ap (! (ap f p) ¬∑ q ¬∑_) (ap-const p) ‚ü© ! (ap f p) ¬∑ q ¬∑ idp ==‚ü® ! (¬∑-runit _) ‚ü© ! (ap f p) ¬∑ q ‚àé


{: .foldable until="7" }

transport-eq-fun-r : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {b : B} ‚Üí (g : A ‚Üí B) {x y : A} ‚Üí (p : x == y) ‚Üí (q : b == g x) ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äì ‚Üí tr (Œª z ‚Üí b == g z) p q == q ¬∑ (ap g p)

transport-eq-fun-r {b = b} g p q = begin transport (Œª z ‚Üí b == g z) p q ==‚ü® transport-eq-fun (Œª _ ‚Üí b) g p q ‚ü© ! (ap (Œª _ ‚Üí b) p) ¬∑ q ¬∑ ap g p ==‚ü® ¬∑-assoc (! (ap (Œª _ ‚Üí b) p)) q (ap g p) ‚ü© ! (ap (Œª _ ‚Üí b) p) ¬∑ (q ¬∑ ap g p) ==‚ü® ap (Œª u ‚Üí ! u ¬∑ (q ¬∑ ap g p)) (ap-const p) ‚ü© (q ¬∑ ap g p) ‚àé


{: .foldable until="6" }

transport-inv : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {a a' : A} ‚Üí (p : a == a') ‚Üí {a : P a'} ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äì ‚Üí tr (Œª x ‚Üí P x) p (tr P (! p) a) == a

transport-inv {P = P} idp {a = a} = begin tr (Œª v ‚Üí P v) idp (tr P (! idp) a) ==‚ü® idp ‚ü© tr P (! idp ¬∑ idp) a ==‚ü®‚ü© tr P idp a ==‚ü® idp ‚ü© a ‚àé


{: .foldable until="6" }

coe-inv-l : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A B : Type ‚Ñì} ‚Üí (p : A == B) ‚Üí (b : B) ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äì ‚Üí tr (Œª v ‚Üí v) p (tr (Œª v ‚Üí v) (! p) b) == b

coe-inv-l idp b = idp


{: .foldable until="6" }

coe-inv-r : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A B : Type ‚Ñì} ‚Üí (p : A == B) ‚Üí (a : A) ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî ‚Üí tr (Œª v ‚Üí v) (! p) (tr (Œª v ‚Üí v) p a) == a

coe-inv-r idp b = idp


{: .foldable until="7" }

transport-family : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {P : B ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ} ‚Üí {f : A ‚Üí B} ‚Üí {x y : A} ‚Üí (p : x == y) ‚Üí (u : P (f x)) ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äì ‚Üí tr (P ‚àò f) p u == tr P (ap f p) u

transport-family idp u = idp


{: .foldable until="6" }

transport-family-id : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} ‚Üí {x y : A} ‚Üí (p : x == y) ‚Üí (u : P x) ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî- ‚Üí transport (Œª a ‚Üí P a) p u == transport P p u

transport-family-id idp u = idp


{: .foldable until="8" }

transport-fun-coe : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A B : Type ‚Ñì} ‚Üí (Œ± : A ‚â° B) ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí A) ‚Üí (g : B ‚Üí B) ‚Üí f == g [ (Œª X ‚Üí (X ‚Üí X)) ‚Üì Œ± ] ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî- ‚Üí f :> coe Œ± == (coe Œ±) :> g

transport-fun-coe idp _ _ idp = idp



{: .foldable until="8" }

transport-fun : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {X : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {x y : X} ‚Üí {A : X ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {B : X ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ} ‚Üí (p : x == y) ‚Üí (f : A x ‚Üí B x) ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî ‚Üí f ‚â° ((Œª a ‚Üí tr B p (f (tr A (! p) a)))) [ (Œª x ‚Üí A x ‚Üí B x) / p ]

transport-fun idp f = idp

‚Äì synonyms back-and-forth = transport-fun

transport-fun-dependent-h : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level}{X : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {A : X ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} ‚Üí {B : (x : X) ‚Üí (a : A x) ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ} {x y : X} ‚Üí (p : x == y) ‚Üí (f : (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a) ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî ‚Üí (a' : A y) ‚Üí (tr (Œª x ‚Üí (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a) p f) a' == tr (Œª w ‚Üí B (œÄ‚ÇÅ w) (œÄ‚ÇÇ w)) (! lift (! p) a' ) (f (tr A (! p) a'))

transport-fun-dependent-h idp f a' = idp

‚Äì synonyms dependent-back-and-forth-h = transport-fun-dependent-h

transport-fun-dependent : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level}{X : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {A : X ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} ‚Üí {B : (x : X) ‚Üí (a : A x) ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ} {x y : X} ‚Üí (p : x == y) ‚Üí (f : (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a) ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî ‚Üí (tr (Œª x ‚Üí (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a) p f) == Œª (a' : A y) ‚Üí tr (Œª w ‚Üí B (œÄ‚ÇÅ w) (œÄ‚ÇÇ w)) (! lift (! p) a' ) (f (tr A (! p) a'))

transport-fun-dependent idp f = idp

‚Äì synonyms dependent-back-and-forth = transport-fun-dependent


When using pathovers, we may need one of these identities:

{: .foldable until="9"}

apOver : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level}{A A' : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {C : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {C' : A' ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ} ‚Üí {a a' : A} {b : C a} {b' : C a'} ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí A') ‚Üí (g : {x : A} ‚Üí C x ‚Üí C' (f x)) ‚Üí (p : a == a') ‚Üí b == b' [ C ‚Üì p ] ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äì ‚Üí g b == g b' [ C' ‚Üì ap f p ]

apOver f g idp q = ap g q



### Action on dependent paths

{: .foldable until="6"}

apd : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {a a' : A} ‚Üí (f : (a : A) ‚Üí P a) ‚Üí (p : a == a') ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äì ‚Üí (f a) == (f a') [ P ‚Üì p ]

apd f idp = idp


Synonyms:

fibre-app-‚â° = apd

ap2d : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {C : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ} ‚Üí (F : ‚àÄ a ‚Üí B a ‚Üí C) ‚Üí {a a' : A} {b : B a} {b' : B a'} ‚Üí (p : a == a') ‚Üí (q : b == b' [ B ‚Üì p ]) ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî- ‚Üí F a b == F a' b'

ap2d F idp idp = idp

ap-idp : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B) ‚Üí {a a' : A} ‚Üí (p : a == a') ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî ‚Üí ap f p == idp [ (Œª x ‚Üí f x == f a') ‚Üì p ]

ap-idp f idp = idp

postulate ap-idp' : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} ‚Üí (f r : A ‚Üí B) ‚Üí (œÉ : ‚àÄ a ‚Üí f a == r a) ‚Üí {a a' : A} ‚Üí (p : a' == a) ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äì ‚Üí (! (œÉ a') ¬∑ ap f p) ¬∑ (œÉ a) == idp [ (</a>v ‚Üí r v == r a) ‚Üì p ]

‚Äì ap-idp' f r œÉ {a = a} idp = {!!}

Coproduct identities




  
module
  CoproductIdentities
  where






‚àë-‚â°
  :  ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} ‚Üí (B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
  ‚Üí {ab ab' : ‚àë A B}
  ‚Üí (p : œÄ‚ÇÅ ab ‚â° œÄ‚ÇÅ ab')
  ‚Üí œÄ‚ÇÇ ab ‚â° œÄ‚ÇÇ ab' [ B / p ]
  --------------------------
  ‚Üí ab ‚â° ab'
‚àë-‚â° B idp idp = idp




œÄ‚ÇÅ-‚â°
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} ‚Üí (B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
  ‚Üí {ab ab' : ‚àë A B}
  ‚Üí ab ‚â° ab'
  ----------------
  ‚Üí œÄ‚ÇÅ ab ‚â° œÄ‚ÇÅ ab'

œÄ‚ÇÅ-‚â° B idp = idp




œÄ‚ÇÇ-‚â°
  :  ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} ‚Üí (B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
  ‚Üí {ab ab' : ‚àë A B}
  ‚Üí (p : ab ‚â° ab')
  ---------------------------------------
  ‚Üí (œÄ‚ÇÇ ab) ‚â° (œÄ‚ÇÇ ab') [ B / (œÄ‚ÇÅ-‚â° B p) ]

œÄ‚ÇÇ-‚â° B idp = idp




‚àë-map
  :  ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ ‚Ñì‚ÇÑ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí {A' : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ} {B' : A' ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÑ}
  ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí A')
  ‚Üí ((a : A) ‚Üí B a ‚Üí B' (f a))
  ----------------------------
  ‚Üí ‚àë A B ‚Üí ‚àë A' B'

‚àë-map f g p = (f (œÄ‚ÇÅ p) , g (œÄ‚ÇÅ p) (œÄ‚ÇÇ p))




‚àë-map-compose
  : ‚àÄ {i‚ÇÄ j‚ÇÄ i‚ÇÅ j‚ÇÅ i‚ÇÇ j‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí {A‚ÇÄ : Type i‚ÇÄ} {B‚ÇÄ : A‚ÇÄ ‚Üí Type j‚ÇÄ}
  ‚Üí {A‚ÇÅ : Type i‚ÇÅ} {B‚ÇÅ : A‚ÇÅ ‚Üí Type j‚ÇÅ}
  ‚Üí {A‚ÇÇ : Type i‚ÇÇ} {B‚ÇÇ : A‚ÇÇ ‚Üí Type j‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí (f‚ÇÄ : A‚ÇÄ ‚Üí A‚ÇÅ) ‚Üí (f‚ÇÅ : (a : A‚ÇÄ) ‚Üí B‚ÇÄ a ‚Üí B‚ÇÅ (f‚ÇÄ a))
  ‚Üí (g‚ÇÄ : A‚ÇÅ ‚Üí A‚ÇÇ) ‚Üí (g‚ÇÅ : (a : A‚ÇÅ) ‚Üí B‚ÇÅ a ‚Üí B‚ÇÇ (g‚ÇÄ a))
  ‚Üí (x : ‚àë A‚ÇÄ B‚ÇÄ)
  -------------------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí ‚àë-map (g‚ÇÄ ‚àò f‚ÇÄ) (Œª a b ‚Üí g‚ÇÅ (f‚ÇÄ a) (f‚ÇÅ a b)) x
  ‚â° (‚àë-map {B' = B‚ÇÇ} g‚ÇÄ g‚ÇÅ (‚àë-map {B' = B‚ÇÅ} f‚ÇÄ f‚ÇÅ x))

‚àë-map-compose _ _ _ _ (a , b) = idp




‚àë-lift
  :  ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {C : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí (‚àÄ a ‚Üí B a ‚Üí C a)
  --------------------
  ‚Üí ‚àë A B ‚Üí ‚àë A C

‚àë-lift f = ‚àë-map id f




Some of the following identities are a customized version of the lemmas above.



module Sigma {‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚Ñì‚±º} {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} where




Two dependent pairs are equal if they are componentwise equal.




  Œ£-componentwise
    : ‚àÄ {v w : Œ£ A P}
    ‚Üí v == w
    ----------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí Œ£ (œÄ‚ÇÅ v == œÄ‚ÇÅ w) (Œª p ‚Üí tr P p (œÄ‚ÇÇ v) == œÄ‚ÇÇ w)

  Œ£-componentwise  idp = (idp , idp)





  Œ£-bycomponents
    : ‚àÄ {v w : Œ£ A P}
    ‚Üí Œ£ (œÄ‚ÇÅ v == œÄ‚ÇÅ w) (Œª p ‚Üí (œÄ‚ÇÇ v) == (œÄ‚ÇÇ w) [ P ‚Üì p ] )
    -----------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí v == w

  Œ£-bycomponents (idp , idp) = idp

  -- synonym of Œ£-bycomponents
  pair= = Œ£-bycomponents




A trivial consequence is the following identification:



  lift-pair=
    : ‚àÄ {x y : A} {u : P x}
    ‚Üí (p : x == y)
    --------------------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí lift {A = A}{C = P} p  u == pair= (p , refl (tr P p u))

  lift-pair= idp = idp




Uniqueness principle property for products


  uppt : (x : Œ£ A P) ‚Üí (œÄ‚ÇÅ x , œÄ‚ÇÇ x) == x
  uppt (a , b) = idp




  Œ£-ap-œÄ‚ÇÅ
    : {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A} {b‚ÇÅ : P a‚ÇÅ} {b‚ÇÇ : P a‚ÇÇ}
    ‚Üí (Œ± : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ)
    ‚Üí (Œ≥ : b‚ÇÅ == b‚ÇÇ [ P ‚Üì Œ± ])
    ------------------------------
    ‚Üí ap œÄ‚ÇÅ (pair= (Œ± , Œ≥)) == Œ±

  Œ£-ap-œÄ‚ÇÅ idp idp = idp




  -- synonym for this lemma
  ap-œÄ‚ÇÅ-pair= = Œ£-ap-œÄ‚ÇÅ




open Sigma public




transport-fun-dependent-bezem
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚Ñì‚±º} {X : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {A : X ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
      {B : (x : X) ‚Üí (a : A x) ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {x y : X}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ‚Üí (f : (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a)
  ‚Üí (a' : A y)
  ----------------------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí (tr (Œª x ‚Üí (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a) p f) a'
    == tr (Œª w ‚Üí B (œÄ‚ÇÅ w) (œÄ‚ÇÇ w))
          (pair= (p , transport-inv p )) (f (tr A (! p) a'))

transport-fun-dependent-bezem idp f a' = idp

Product identities




  
module
  ProductIdentities
  where







prodComponentwise
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {x y : A √ó B}
  ‚Üí (x == y)
  ---------------------------------
  ‚Üí (œÄ‚ÇÅ x == œÄ‚ÇÅ y) √ó (œÄ‚ÇÇ x == œÄ‚ÇÇ y)

prodComponentwise {x = x} idp = refl (œÄ‚ÇÅ x) , refl (œÄ‚ÇÇ x)





prodByComponents
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {x y : A √ó B}
  ‚Üí (œÄ‚ÇÅ x == œÄ‚ÇÅ y) √ó (œÄ‚ÇÇ x == œÄ‚ÇÇ y)
  ---------------------------------
  ‚Üí (x == y)

prodByComponents {x = a , b} (idp , idp) = refl (a , b)





prodCompInverse
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {x y : A √ó B}
  ‚Üí (b : (œÄ‚ÇÅ x == œÄ‚ÇÅ y) √ó (œÄ‚ÇÇ x == œÄ‚ÇÇ y))
  ---------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí prodComponentwise (prodByComponents b) == b

prodCompInverse {x = x} (idp , idp) = refl (refl (œÄ‚ÇÅ x) , refl (œÄ‚ÇÇ x))





prodByCompInverse
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}  {x y : A √ó B}
  ‚Üí (b : x == y)
  ---------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí prodByComponents (prodComponentwise b) == b

prodByCompInverse {x = x} idp = refl (refl x)




√ó-‚â°
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} 
  ‚Üí {ab ab' : A √ó B}
  ‚Üí (p : œÄ‚ÇÅ ab ‚â° œÄ‚ÇÅ ab') ‚Üí (œÄ‚ÇÇ ab) ‚â° œÄ‚ÇÇ ab'
  ‚Üí ab ‚â° ab'

√ó-‚â° idp idp = idp

When ‚àë and ‚àè commute




  
{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}

sum-commute
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}
  ‚Üí (B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ) (C : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ)
    -----------------------------------------
  ‚Üí Œ£ (Œ£ A B) (C ‚àò fst) ‚âÉ Œ£ (Œ£ A C) (B ‚àò fst)

sum-commute {A = A} B C = qinv-‚âÉ there (back , there-back , back-there)
  where
  there : Œ£ (Œ£ A B) (C ‚àò fst) ‚Üí Œ£ (Œ£ A C) (B ‚àò fst)
  there ((a , b) , c) = ((a , c ) , b)

  back : Œ£ (Œ£ A C) (B ‚àò fst) ‚Üí Œ£ (Œ£ A B) (C ‚àò fst)
  back  ((a , c ) , b) = ((a , b) , c)

  there-back : ‚àÄ acb ‚Üí there (back acb) == acb
  there-back ((a , c) , b) = idp

  back-there : ‚àÄ abc ‚Üí back (there abc) == abc
  back-there ((a , b) , c) = idp




prod-commute
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}
  ‚Üí (B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
  ‚Üí (C : {a : A} ‚Üí B a ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ)
  -----------------------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí (Œ£ (Œ† A B) (Œª f ‚Üí Œ† A (C ‚àò f))) ‚âÉ (Œ† A (Œª x ‚Üí Œ£ (B x) C))

prod-commute {A = A} B C = qinv-‚âÉ there (back , there-back , back-there)
  where
  there : (Œ£ (Œ† A B) (\f ‚Üí Œ† A (C ‚àò f))) ‚Üí (Œ† A (\x ‚Üí Œ£ (B x) C))
  there (f , s) x = (f x , s x)

  back : (Œ† A (\x ‚Üí Œ£ (B x) C)) ‚Üí (Œ£ (Œ† A B) (\f ‚Üí Œ† A (C ‚àò f)))
  back  F = (\x ‚Üí fst (F x)) , (\x ‚Üí snd (F x))

  there-back : ‚àÄ F ‚Üí there (back F) == F
  there-back F = idp

  back-there : ‚àÄ fs ‚Üí back (there fs) == fs
  back-there fs = idp

Fibre type



module
  FibreType {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
    where




  fibre
    : (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí (b : B)
    ---------------
    ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)

  fibre f b = Œ£ A (Œª a ‚Üí f a == b)




Synomyms and syntax sugar:



  fib   = fibre
  fiber = fibre

  syntax fibre f b = f // b




A function applied over the fiber returns the original point



  fib-eq
    : ‚àÄ {f : A ‚Üí B} {b : B}
    ‚Üí (h : fib f b)
    ------------------
    ‚Üí f (proj‚ÇÅ h) == b

  fib-eq (a , Œ±) = Œ±




Each point is on the fiber of its image.



  fib-image
    :  ‚àÄ {f : A ‚Üí B} ‚Üí {a : A}
    ‚Üí fib f (f a)

  fib-image {f} {a} = a , refl (f a)

Homotopies




  
In a type-theoretical sense, a homotopy between two
functions is a family of equalities between their applications.





The context:


module HomotopyType {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} where




Let  be two sections of a
type family . A homotopy from  to 
is a dependent function of type





Homotopy types




  homotopy
    : (f g : Œ† A P)
    ---------------
    ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)

  homotopy f g = ‚àÄ (x : A) ‚Üí f x == g x




  -- Usual notation for homotopy
  _‚àº_ : (f g : ((x : A) ‚Üí P x)) ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
  f ‚àº g = homotopy f g




Homotopy is an equivalence relation



  -- Homotopy is an equivalence relation
  h-refl
    : (f : Œ† A P)
    -------------
    ‚Üí f ‚àº f

  h-refl f x = idp





  h-sym
    : (f g : Œ† A P)
    ‚Üí f ‚àº g
    -------
    ‚Üí g ‚àº f

  h-sym _ _ e x = ! (e x)





  h-comp
    : {f g h : Œ† A P}
    ‚Üí f ‚àº g
    ‚Üí g ‚àº h
    -------
    ‚Üí f ‚àº h

  h-comp u v x = (u x) ¬∑ (v x)




  -- synonym for h-comp
  _‚óè_
    : {f g h : Œ† A P}
    ‚Üí f ‚àº g
    ‚Üí g ‚àº h
    -------
    ‚Üí f ‚àº h

  Œ± ‚óè Œ≤ = h-comp Œ± Œ≤

Composition with homotopies



hl-comp
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {C : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
  ‚Üí {f g : A ‚Üí B}
  ‚Üí {j k : B ‚Üí C}
  ‚Üí f ‚àº g
  ‚Üí j ‚àº k
  -------------------
  ‚Üí (j ‚àò f) ‚àº (k ‚àò g)

hl-comp {g = g}{j = j} f-g j-k = Œª x ‚Üí ap j (f-g x) ¬∑ j-k (g x)




rcomp-‚àº
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {C : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
  ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
  ‚Üí {j k : B ‚Üí C}
  ‚Üí j ‚àº k
  -------------------
  ‚Üí (j ‚àò f) ‚àº (k ‚àò f)

rcomp-‚àº f j-k = hl-comp (h-refl f) j-k




lcomp-‚àº
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {C : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
  ‚Üí {f g : A ‚Üí B}
  ‚Üí (j : B ‚Üí C)
  ‚Üí f ‚àº g
  -------------------
  ‚Üí (j ‚àò f) ‚àº (j ‚àò g)

lcomp-‚àº j Œ± = hl-comp Œ± (h-refl j)




Naturality



Homotopy is natural, meaning that it satisfies the following
square commutative diagram.






h-naturality
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí {f g : A ‚Üí B} ‚Üí {x y : A}
  ‚Üí (H : f ‚àº g)
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ------------------------------
  ‚Üí H x ¬∑ ap g p == ap f p ¬∑ H y

h-naturality {x = x} H idp = ! (¬∑-runit (H x))




A particular case of naturality on the identity function.



h-naturality-id
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì}  {f : A ‚Üí A} ‚Üí {x : A}
  ‚Üí (H : f ‚àº id)
  -----------------------
  ‚Üí H (f x) == ap f (H x)

h-naturality-id {f = f} {x = x} H =
  begin
    H (f x)
      ==‚ü® ¬∑-runit (H (f x)) ‚ü©
    H (f x) ¬∑ refl (f x)
      ==‚ü® ap (H (f x) ¬∑_) (! (¬∑-rinv (H x))) ‚ü©
    H (f x) ¬∑ ((H x) ¬∑ (! (H x)))
      ==‚ü® ap (H (f x) ¬∑_) (ap (_¬∑ (! (H x))) (! ap-id (H x))) ‚ü©
    H (f x) ¬∑ (ap id (H x) ¬∑ ! (H x))
      ==‚ü® ! (¬∑-assoc (H (f x)) (ap id (H x)) (! (H x))) ‚ü©
    (H (f x) ¬∑ ap id (H x)) ¬∑ ! (H x)
      ==‚ü® ¬∑-right-to-left-r (h-naturality H (H x)) ‚ü©
    ap f (H x)
  ‚àé

Function extensionality




module FunExtAxiom {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}
  {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {f g : (a : A) ‚Üí B a} where




  -- Application of an homotopy
  happly
    : f == g
    ------------------------
    ‚Üí ((x : A) ‚Üí f x == g x)

  happly idp x = refl (f x)

  -- synonyms:
  ‚â°-app = happly




  postulate
    axiomFunExt : isEquiv happly




  eqFunExt
    : (f == g) ‚âÉ ((x : A) ‚Üí f x == g x)

  eqFunExt = happly , axiomFunExt




  -- From this, the usual notion of function extensionality follows.
  funext
    : ((x : A) ‚Üí f x == g x)
    ------------------------
    ‚Üí f == g

  funext = remap eqFunExt




  -- Beta and eta rules for function extensionality
  funext-Œ≤
    : (h : ((x : A) ‚Üí f x == g x))
    ------------------------------
    ‚Üí happly (funext h) == h

  funext-Œ≤ h = lrmap-inverse eqFunExt




  funext-Œ∑
    : (p : f == g)
    ------------------------
    ‚Üí funext (happly p) == p

  funext-Œ∑ p = rlmap-inverse eqFunExt

Function extensionality in the transport case



module
  FunExtTransport {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level}{X : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {A B : X ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {x y : X}
    where




  funext-transport
    : (p : x == y) ‚Üí (f : A x ‚Üí B x) ‚Üí (g : A y ‚Üí B y)
    ------------------------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí (tr (Œª z‚ÇÅ ‚Üí (x : A z‚ÇÅ) ‚Üí B z‚ÇÅ) p f == g)
    ‚âÉ ((a : A(x)) ‚Üí tr B p (f a) == g (tr A p a))

  funext-transport idp f g = eqFunExt




  funext-transport-l
    : (p : x == y)
    ‚Üí (f : A x ‚Üí B x)
    ‚Üí (g : A y ‚Üí B y)
    ‚Üí ((tr (Œª z‚ÇÅ ‚Üí (x : A z‚ÇÅ) ‚Üí B z‚ÇÅ) p f == g)
    -------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí ((a : A(x)) ‚Üí tr B p (f a) == g (tr A p a)))

  funext-transport-l p f g = lemap (funext-transport p _ _)




  funext-transport-r
    : (p : x == y)
    ‚Üí (f : A x ‚Üí B x)
    ‚Üí (g : A y ‚Üí B y)
    ‚Üí ((a : A(x)) ‚Üí tr B p (f a) == g (tr A p a))
    -------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí (tr (Œª z‚ÇÅ ‚Üí (x : A z‚ÇÅ) ‚Üí B z‚ÇÅ) p f == g)

  funext-transport-r p f g = remap (funext-transport p _ _)

{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}
module _ where

module
  FunExtTransportDependent
  {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level}{X : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {A : X ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}{B : (x : X) ‚Üí A x ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}{x y : X}
  where




  funext-transport-dfun
    : (p : x == y)
    ‚Üí (f : (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a)
    ‚Üí (g : (a : A y) ‚Üí B y a)
    ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí   (f == g
            [ (Œª z‚ÇÅ ‚Üí (x : A z‚ÇÅ) ‚Üí B z‚ÇÅ x) ‚Üì p ])
      ‚âÉ ((a : A x) ‚Üí
        (f a) == g (tr A p a)
               [ (Œª w ‚Üí B (œÄ‚ÇÅ w) (œÄ‚ÇÇ w)) ‚Üì (pair= (p , refl (tr A p a))) ])

  funext-transport-dfun idp f g = eqFunExt




  funext-transport-dfun-l
    : (p : x == y) ‚Üí (f : (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a) ‚Üí (g : (a : A y) ‚Üí B y a)
   ‚Üí (tr (Œª z‚ÇÅ ‚Üí (x : A z‚ÇÅ) ‚Üí B z‚ÇÅ x) p f == g)
    ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí (a : A x) ‚Üí
         (f a) == g (tr A p a)
                [ (Œª w ‚Üí B (œÄ‚ÇÅ w) (œÄ‚ÇÇ w)) ‚Üì (pair= (p , refl (tr A p a))) ]

  funext-transport-dfun-l p f g = lemap (funext-transport-dfun p _ _)




  funext-transport-dfun-r
    : (p : x == y)
    ‚Üí (f : (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a)
    ‚Üí (g : (a : A y) ‚Üí B y a)
    ‚Üí ((a : A x) ‚Üí tr (Œª w ‚Üí B (œÄ‚ÇÅ w) (œÄ‚ÇÇ w)) (pair= (p , refl (tr A p a))) (f a) == g (tr A p a))
    --------------------------------------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí (tr (Œª z‚ÇÅ ‚Üí (x : A z‚ÇÅ) ‚Üí B z‚ÇÅ x) p f == g)

  funext-transport-dfun-r p f g = remap (funext-transport-dfun p _ _)




funext-transport-dfun-bezem
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {X : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{A : X ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}{B : (x : X) ‚Üí A x ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ} {x y : X}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ‚Üí (f : (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a)
  ‚Üí (g : (a : A y) ‚Üí B y a)
  ‚Üí (a : A y)
  ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí (tr (Œª x ‚Üí (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a) p f) a == g a
  ‚âÉ  tr (Œª w ‚Üí B (œÄ‚ÇÅ w) (œÄ‚ÇÇ w)) (pair= (p , transport-inv p)) (f (tr A (! p)a)) == g a

funext-transport-dfun-bezem idp f g a = idEqv




funext-transport-dfun-bezem-l
  :  ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {X : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{A : X ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}{B : (x : X) ‚Üí A x ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ} {x y : X}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ‚Üí (f : (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a)
  ‚Üí (g : (a : A y) ‚Üí B y a)
  ‚Üí (a : A y)
  ‚Üí (tr (Œª x ‚Üí (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a) p f) a == g a
  ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí  tr (Œª w ‚Üí B (œÄ‚ÇÅ w) (œÄ‚ÇÇ w)) (pair= (p , transport-inv p)) (f (tr A (! p) a)) == g a

funext-transport-dfun-bezem-l p f g a x‚ÇÅ = lemap (funext-transport-dfun-bezem p f g a) x‚ÇÅ




funext-transport-dfun-bezem-r
  :  ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {X : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{A : X ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}{B : (x : X) ‚Üí A x ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ} {x y : X}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ‚Üí (f : (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a)
  ‚Üí (g : (a : A y) ‚Üí B y a)
  ‚Üí (a : A y)
  ‚Üí  tr (Œª w ‚Üí B (œÄ‚ÇÅ w) (œÄ‚ÇÇ w)) (pair= (p , transport-inv p)) (f (tr A (! p) a)) == g a
  ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí (tr (Œª x ‚Üí (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a) p f) a == g a

funext-transport-dfun-bezem-r p f g a x‚ÇÅ = remap (funext-transport-dfun-bezem p f g a) x‚ÇÅ

Decidable equality



A type has decidable equality if any two of its
elements are equal or different. This would be a particular
instance of the Law of Excluded Middle that holds even if we do not
assume Excluded Middle.



module DecidableEquality where




  decEq
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} ‚Üí (A : Type ‚Ñì) ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì

  decEq A = (a b : A) ‚Üí (a == b) + ¬¨ (a == b)




The product of types with decidable equality is a type with
decidable equality.



  decEqProd
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} {A B : Type ‚Ñì} 
    ‚Üí decEq A ‚Üí decEq B
    -------------------
    ‚Üí decEq (A √ó B)

  decEqProd da db (a1 , b1) (a2 , b2)
   with (da a1 a2) | (db b1 b2)
  ... | inl aeq | inl beq = inl (prodByComponents (aeq , beq))
  ... | inl _   | inr bnq = inr Œª b ‚Üí bnq (ap œÄ‚ÇÇ b)
  ... | inr anq | _       = inr Œª b ‚Üí anq (ap œÄ‚ÇÅ b)




This surely can be extend to other types.

Equivalences



module EquivalenceType where




There are three definitions to say a function is an
equivalence. All these definitions
are required to be mere propositions and to hold
the bi-implication of begin quasi-inverse. We show
this clearly in what follows. Nevertheless, we want to get
the following fact:





Contractible maps



A map is contractible if the fiber in any point is contractible, that is, each
element has a unique preimagen.



isContrMap
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
  ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)

isContrMap {B = B} f = (b : B) ‚Üí isContr (fib f b)




Synomyns:


map-contractible = isContrMap




There exists an equivalence between two types if there exists a
contractible function between them.



isEquiv
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
  ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)

isEquiv f = isContrMap f




Synomyms:



isEquivalence  = isEquiv
is-equivalence = isEquiv




Equivalence Type



_‚âÉ_
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} (A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ)(B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
  ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)

A ‚âÉ B = Œ£ (A ‚Üí B) isEquiv




module EquivalenceMaps {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}  where




  lemap
    : A ‚âÉ B
    -------
    ‚Üí (A ‚Üí B)

  lemap = œÄ‚ÇÅ




Synonyms:



  ‚âÉ-to-‚Üí = lemap
  fun‚âÉ   = lemap
  _‚àô     = lemap
  _‚àô‚Üí    = lemap
  apply  = lemap

  infixl 70 _‚àô _‚àô‚Üí




  remap
    : A ‚âÉ B
    ---------
    ‚Üí (B ‚Üí A)

  remap (f , contrf) b = œÄ‚ÇÅ (œÄ‚ÇÅ (contrf b))




  ‚âÉ-to-‚Üê  = remap
  invfun‚âÉ = remap
  _‚àô‚Üê     = remap
  rapply  = remap

  infixl 70 _‚àô‚Üê




The maps of an equivalence are inverses in particular



  lrmap-inverse
    : (e : A ‚âÉ B) ‚Üí {b : B}
    -----------------------
    ‚Üí (e ‚àô‚Üí) ((e ‚àô‚Üê) b) == b

  lrmap-inverse (f , eqf) {b} = fib-eq (œÄ‚ÇÅ (eqf b))




  ‚àô‚Üí‚àò‚àô‚Üê = lrmap-inverse




  rlmap-inverse
    : (e : A ‚âÉ B) ‚Üí {a : A}
    ------------------------
    ‚Üí (e ‚àô‚Üê) ((e ‚àô‚Üí) a) == a

  rlmap-inverse (f , eqf) {a} = ap œÄ‚ÇÅ ((œÄ‚ÇÇ (eqf (f a))) fib-image)



  ‚àô‚Üê‚àò‚àô‚Üí = rlmap-inverse




  lrmap-inverse-h
    : (e : A ‚âÉ B)
    ------------------------
    ‚Üí ((e ‚àô‚Üí) ‚àò (e ‚àô‚Üê)) ‚àº id

  lrmap-inverse-h e = Œª x ‚Üí lrmap-inverse e {x}




  ‚àô‚Üí‚àò‚àô‚Üê-h = lrmap-inverse-h




  rlmap-inverse-h
    : (e : A ‚âÉ B)
    ------------------------
    ‚Üí ((e ‚àô‚Üê) ‚àò (e ‚àô‚Üí)) ‚àº id

  rlmap-inverse-h e = Œª x ‚Üí rlmap-inverse e {x}




  ‚àô‚Üê‚àò‚àô‚Üí-h = rlmap-inverse-h




open EquivalenceMaps public

Quasiinverses



Two functions are quasi-inverses if we can construct a function providing
(g ‚àò f) x = x and (f ‚àò g) y = y for any given x and y.




  
{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}
open import TransportLemmas
open import EquivalenceType

open import HomotopyType
open import HomotopyLemmas


open import HalfAdjointType






module QuasiinverseType {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} where




  qinv
    : (A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)

  qinv f = Œ£ (B ‚Üí A) (Œª g ‚Üí ((f ‚àò g) ‚àº id) √ó ((g ‚àò f) ‚àº id))

  quasiinverse = qinv




  linv
    : (A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)

  linv f = Œ£ (B ‚Üí A) (Œª g ‚Üí (g ‚àò f) ‚àº idf A)

  left-inverse = linv




  rinv
    : (A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)

  rinv f = Œ£ (B ‚Üí A) (Œª g ‚Üí (f ‚àò g) ‚àº idf B)

  right-inverse = rinv




Biinverse is another equivalent notion of the right equivalence for HoTT.


  biinv : (A ‚Üí B) ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
  biinv f = linv f √ó rinv f

  biinverse  = biinv
  bi-inverse = biinv




A desire consequence (qinv ‚Üí biinv):



  qinv-biinv : (f : A ‚Üí B) ‚Üí qinv f ‚Üí biinv f
  qinv-biinv f (g , (u1 , u2)) = (g , u2) , (g , u1)

  biinv-qinv : (f : A ‚Üí B) ‚Üí biinv f ‚Üí qinv f
  biinv-qinv f ((h , Œ±) , (g , Œ≤)) = g , (Œ≤ , Œ¥)
    where
      Œ≥1 : g ‚àº ((h ‚àò f) ‚àò g)
      Œ≥1 = rcomp-‚àº g (h-sym (h ‚àò f) id Œ±)

      Œ≥2 : ((h ‚àò f) ‚àò g) ‚àº (h ‚àò (f ‚àò g))
      Œ≥2 x = idp

      Œ≥ : g ‚àº h
      Œ≥ = Œ≥1 ‚óè (Œ≥2 ‚óè (lcomp-‚àº h Œ≤))

      Œ¥ : (g ‚àò f) ‚àº id
      Œ¥ = (rcomp-‚àº f Œ≥) ‚óè Œ±

  equiv-biinv : (f : A ‚Üí B) ‚Üí isContrMap f ‚Üí biinv f
  equiv-biinv f contrf =
    (remap eq , rlmap-inverse-h eq) , (remap eq , lrmap-inverse-h eq)
    where
      eq : A ‚âÉ B
      eq = f , contrf

  -- Quasiinverses are halfadjoint equivalences.
  qinv-ishae : {f : A ‚Üí B} ‚Üí qinv f ‚Üí ishae f
  qinv-ishae {f} (g , (Œµ , Œ∑)) = record {
      g = g ;
      Œ∑ = Œ∑ ;
      Œµ = Œª b ‚Üí inv (Œµ (f (g b))) ¬∑ ap f (Œ∑ (g b)) ¬∑ Œµ b ;
      œÑ = œÑ
    }
    where
      aux-lemma : (a : A) ‚Üí ap f (Œ∑ (g (f a))) ¬∑ Œµ (f a) == Œµ (f (g (f a))) ¬∑ ap f (Œ∑ a)
      aux-lemma a =
        begin
          ap f (Œ∑ ((g ‚àò f) a)) ¬∑ Œµ (f a)
            ==‚ü® ap (Œª u ‚Üí ap f u ¬∑ Œµ (f a)) (h-naturality-id Œ∑) ‚ü©
          ap f (ap (g ‚àò f) (Œ∑ a)) ¬∑ Œµ (f a)
            ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ Œµ (f a)) (ap-comp (g ‚àò f) f (Œ∑ a)) ‚ü©
          ap (f ‚àò (g ‚àò f)) (Œ∑ a) ¬∑ Œµ (f a)
            ==‚ü® inv (h-naturality (Œª x ‚Üí Œµ (f x)) (Œ∑ a)) ‚ü©
          Œµ (f (g (f a))) ¬∑ ap f (Œ∑ a)
        ‚àé

      œÑ : (a : A) ‚Üí ap f (Œ∑ a) == (inv (Œµ (f (g (f a)))) ¬∑ ap f (Œ∑ (g (f a))) ¬∑ Œµ (f a))
      œÑ a =
        begin
          ap f (Œ∑ a)
            ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ ap f (Œ∑ a)) (inv (¬∑-linv (Œµ (f (g (f a)))))) ‚ü©
          inv (Œµ (f (g (f a)))) ¬∑ Œµ (f (g (f a))) ¬∑ ap f (Œ∑ a)
            ==‚ü® ¬∑-assoc (inv (Œµ (f (g (f a))))) _ (ap f (Œ∑ a)) ‚ü©
          inv (Œµ (f (g (f a)))) ¬∑ (Œµ (f (g (f a))) ¬∑ ap f (Œ∑ a))
            ==‚ü® ap (inv (Œµ (f (g (f a)))) ¬∑_) (inv (aux-lemma a)) ‚ü©
          inv (Œµ (f (g (f a)))) ¬∑ (ap f (Œ∑ (g (f a))) ¬∑ Œµ (f a))
            ==‚ü® inv (¬∑-assoc (inv (Œµ (f (g (f a))))) _ (Œµ (f a))) ‚ü©
          inv (Œµ (f (g (f a)))) ¬∑ ap f (Œ∑ (g (f a))) ¬∑ Œµ (f a)
        ‚àé




Quasiinverses create equivalences.



  qinv-‚âÉ
    : (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí qinv f
    -------------
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ B

  qinv-‚âÉ f = ishae-‚âÉ ‚àò qinv-ishae

  quasiinverse-to-‚âÉ = qinv-‚âÉ




  ‚âÉ-qinv
    : A ‚âÉ B
    ----------------
    ‚Üí Œ£ (A ‚Üí B) qinv

  ‚âÉ-qinv eq =
    lemap eq , (remap eq , (lrmap-inverse-h eq , rlmap-inverse-h eq))

  ‚âÉ-to-quasiinverse = ‚âÉ-qinv




Half-adjoint equivalences are quasiinverses.



  ishae-qinv
    : {f : A ‚Üí B}
    ‚Üí ishae f
    ---------
    ‚Üí qinv f

  ishae-qinv {f} (hae g Œ∑ Œµ œÑ) = g , (Œµ , Œ∑)




  ‚âÉ-ishae
    : (e : A ‚âÉ B)
    --------------
    ‚Üí ishae (e ‚àô‚Üí)

  ‚âÉ-ishae e = qinv-ishae (œÄ‚ÇÇ (‚âÉ-qinv e))

Quasiinverse Lemmas



Two functions are quasi-inverses if we can construct a function providing

Equivalence composition



module QuasiinverseLemmas where




The equivalence types are indeed equivalence



  -- Composition of quasiinverses
  qinv-comp
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}{C : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
    ‚Üí Œ£ (A ‚Üí B) qinv
    ‚Üí Œ£ (B ‚Üí C) qinv
    ----------------
    ‚Üí Œ£ (A ‚Üí C) qinv

  qinv-comp (f , (if , (Œµf , Œ∑f))) (g , (ig , (Œµg , Œ∑g))) = (g ‚àò f) , ((if ‚àò ig) ,
     ( (Œª x ‚Üí ap g (Œµf (ig x)) ¬∑ Œµg x)
     ,  Œª x ‚Üí ap if (Œ∑g (f x)) ¬∑ Œ∑f x))




  -- Lemma.
  qinv-inv
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
    ‚Üí Œ£ (A ‚Üí B) qinv
    ----------------
    ‚Üí Œ£ (B ‚Üí A) qinv

  qinv-inv (f , (g , (Œµ , Œ∑))) = g , (f , (Œ∑ , Œµ))




Equivalence types are equivalence relations.



  idEqv
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì} {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    -------
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ A

  idEqv = id , Œª a ‚Üí (a , refl a) , Œª { (_ , idp) ‚Üí refl (a , refl a) }

  -- Synonyms
  ‚âÉ-refl = idEqv
  A‚âÉA    = idEqv




  -- Lemma.
  _:>‚âÉ_
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}{C : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ B
    ‚Üí B ‚âÉ C
    -------
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ C

  _:>‚âÉ_ {A = A} {C = C} eq-f eq-g = qinv-‚âÉ (œÄ‚ÇÅ qcomp) (œÄ‚ÇÇ qcomp)
   where
     qcomp : Œ£ (A ‚Üí C) qinv
     qcomp = qinv-comp (‚âÉ-qinv eq-f) (‚âÉ-qinv eq-g)

  -- Synonyms
  compEqv = _:>‚âÉ_
  ‚âÉ-trans = _:>‚âÉ_
  _‚àò‚âÉ_    = _:>‚âÉ_




  ‚âÉ-sym
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ B
    -------
    ‚Üí B ‚âÉ A

  ‚âÉ-sym {‚Ñì}{_} {A} {B} eq-f = qinv-‚âÉ (œÄ‚ÇÅ qcinv) (œÄ‚ÇÇ qcinv)
   where
     qcinv : Œ£ (B ‚Üí A) qinv
     qcinv = qinv-inv (‚âÉ-qinv eq-f)

  -- Synonyms
  invEqv = ‚âÉ-sym
  ‚âÉ-flip = ‚âÉ-sym

Biinverses



Two functions are quasi-inverses if we can construct a function providing
(g ‚àò f) x = x and (f ‚àò g) y = y for any given x and y.




  
{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}

module
  BiinverseEquivalenceType {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level}{A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
   where




  record
    Equivalence {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} (f : A ‚Üí B)
    : Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî  ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
    where
    constructor equivalence
    field
      left-inverse   : B ‚Üí A
      right-inverse  : B ‚Üí A
      left-identity  : ‚àÄ a ‚Üí  left-inverse (f a) ‚â° a
      right-identity : ‚àÄ b ‚Üí f (right-inverse b) ‚â° b

  infix 10 _‚âÉ_




Synonym:


  biinv
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî  ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
  biinv f = Equivalence f




  isequiv
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî  ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
  isequiv f = Equivalence f




  record
    _‚âÉ_ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} (A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ) (B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
    : Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
    where
    constructor eq
    field
      apply-eq : A ‚Üí B
      biinverse : Equivalence apply-eq




  ide
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ A

  ide = eq id (equivalence id id (Œª a ‚Üí idp) (Œª a ‚Üí idp))




  ‚âÉ-from-‚â°
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}
    ‚Üí (F : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
    ‚Üí (a b : A)
    ‚Üí a ‚â° b ‚Üí F a ‚âÉ F b

  ‚âÉ-from-‚â° F a b p = tr‚ÇÅ (_‚âÉ_ _ ‚àò F) p ide

Half-adjoints



Half-adjoints are an auxiliary notion that helps us to define a suitable notion
of equivalence, meaning that it is a proposition and that it captures the usual
notion of equivalence.




  
{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}
open import Transport
open import TransportLemmas

open import ProductIdentities
open import CoproductIdentities

open import EquivalenceType

open import HomotopyType
open import HomotopyLemmas
open import FibreType






module
  HalfAdjointType {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
    where




Half adjoint equivalence:


    record
      ishae (f : A ‚Üí B)
      : Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
      where
      constructor hae
      field
        g : B ‚Üí A
        Œ∑ : (g ‚àò f) ‚àº id
        Œµ : (f ‚àò g) ‚àº id
        œÑ : (a : A) ‚Üí ap f (Œ∑ a) == Œµ (f a)




Half adjoint equivalences give contractible fibers.



    ishae-contr
      : (f : A ‚Üí B)
      ‚Üí ishae f
      -------------
      ‚Üí isContrMap f

    ishae-contr f (hae g Œ∑ Œµ œÑ) y = ((g y) , (Œµ y)) , contra
      where
        lemma : (c c' : fib f y) ‚Üí Œ£ (œÄ‚ÇÅ c == œÄ‚ÇÅ c') (Œª Œ≥ ‚Üí (ap f Œ≥) ¬∑ œÄ‚ÇÇ c' == œÄ‚ÇÇ c) ‚Üí c == c'
        lemma c c' (p , q) = Œ£-bycomponents (p , lemma2)
          where
            lemma2 : transport (Œª z ‚Üí f z == y) p (œÄ‚ÇÇ c) == œÄ‚ÇÇ c'
            lemma2 =
              begin
                transport (Œª z ‚Üí f z == y) p (œÄ‚ÇÇ c)
                  ==‚ü® transport-eq-fun-l f p (œÄ‚ÇÇ c) ‚ü©
                inv (ap f p) ¬∑ (œÄ‚ÇÇ c)
                  ==‚ü® ap (inv (ap f p) ¬∑_) (inv q) ‚ü©
                inv (ap f p) ¬∑ ((ap f p) ¬∑ (œÄ‚ÇÇ c'))
                  ==‚ü® inv (¬∑-assoc (inv (ap f p)) (ap f p) (œÄ‚ÇÇ c')) ‚ü©
                inv (ap f p) ¬∑ (ap f p) ¬∑ (œÄ‚ÇÇ c')
                  ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ (œÄ‚ÇÇ c')) (¬∑-linv (ap f p)) ‚ü©
                œÄ‚ÇÇ c'
              ‚àé

        contra : (x : fib f y) ‚Üí (g y , Œµ y) == x
        contra (x , p) = lemma (g y , Œµ y) (x , p) (Œ≥ , lemma3)
          where
            Œ≥ : g y == x
            Œ≥ = inv (ap g p) ¬∑ Œ∑ x

            lemma3 : (ap f Œ≥ ¬∑ p) == Œµ y
            lemma3 =
              begin
                ap f Œ≥ ¬∑ p
                  ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ p) (ap-¬∑ f (inv (ap g p)) (Œ∑ x)) ‚ü©
                ap f (inv (ap g p)) ¬∑ ap f (Œ∑ x) ¬∑ p
                  ==‚ü® ¬∑-assoc (ap f (inv (ap g p))) _ p ‚ü©
                ap f (inv (ap g p)) ¬∑ (ap f (Œ∑ x) ¬∑ p)
                  ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ (ap f (Œ∑ x) ¬∑ p)) (ap-inv f (ap g p)) ‚ü©
                inv (ap f (ap g p)) ¬∑ (ap f (Œ∑ x) ¬∑ p)
                  ==‚ü® ap (Œª u ‚Üí inv (ap f (ap g p)) ¬∑ (u ¬∑ p)) (œÑ x) ‚ü©
                inv (ap f (ap g p)) ¬∑ (Œµ (f x) ¬∑ p)
                  ==‚ü® ap (Œª u ‚Üí inv (ap f (ap g p)) ¬∑ (Œµ (f x) ¬∑ u)) (inv (ap-id p)) ‚ü©
                inv (ap f (ap g p)) ¬∑ (Œµ (f x) ¬∑ ap id p)
                  ==‚ü® ap (inv (ap f (ap g p)) ¬∑_) (h-naturality Œµ p) ‚ü©
                inv (ap f (ap g p)) ¬∑ (ap (f ‚àò g) p ¬∑ Œµ y)
                  ==‚ü® ap (Œª u ‚Üí inv u ¬∑ (ap (f ‚àò g) p ¬∑ Œµ y)) (ap-comp g f p) ‚ü©
                inv (ap (f ‚àò g) p) ¬∑ (ap (f ‚àò g) p ¬∑ Œµ y)
                  ==‚ü® inv (¬∑-assoc (inv (ap (f ‚àò g) p)) _ (Œµ y)) ‚ü©
                (inv (ap (f ‚àò g) p) ¬∑ ap (f ‚àò g) p) ¬∑ Œµ y
                  ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ Œµ y) (¬∑-linv (ap (Œª z ‚Üí f (g z)) p)) ‚ü©
                Œµ y
              ‚àé




Half-adjointness implies equivalence:


    ishae-‚âÉ
      : {f : A ‚Üí B}
      ‚Üí ishae f
      ---------
      ‚Üí A ‚âÉ B

    ishae-‚âÉ ishaef = _ , (ishae-contr _ ishaef)

Equivalence reasoning



module EquivalenceReasoning where




  _‚âÉ‚ü®‚ü©_
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} (A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ) {B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ B
    -------
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ B

  _ ‚âÉ‚ü®‚ü© e = e
  infixr 2 _‚âÉ‚ü®‚ü©_




  _‚âÉ‚ü®by-def‚ü©_
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} (A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ) {B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ B
    -------
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ B

  _ ‚âÉ‚ü®by-def‚ü© e = e
  infixr 2 _‚âÉ‚ü®by-def‚ü©_




  _‚âÉ‚ü®_‚ü©_
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} (A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ){B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {C : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ B ‚Üí B ‚âÉ C
    ---------------
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ C

  _ ‚âÉ‚ü® e‚ÇÅ ‚ü© e‚ÇÇ = ‚âÉ-trans e‚ÇÅ e‚ÇÇ

  infixr 2 _‚âÉ‚ü®_‚ü©_




  _‚âÉ‚àé
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì : Level} (A : Type ‚Ñì)
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ A

  _‚âÉ‚àé = Œª A ‚Üí idEqv {A = A}
  infix  3 _‚âÉ‚àé




  begin‚âÉ_
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ B
    -------
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ B

  begin‚âÉ_ e = e
  infix  1 begin‚âÉ_

Basic Equivalences



There are some well-known equivalences very handy about
product and coproducts.



{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}
open import BasicTypes
open import BasicFunctions
open import AlgebraOnPaths
open import EquivalenceType
open import HomotopyType
open import QuasiinverseType
open import EquivalenceReasoning

module BasicEquivalences where




  ‚âÉ-+-comm
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {X : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{Y : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
    ‚Üí X + Y ‚âÉ Y + X

  ‚âÉ-+-comm {X = X}{Y} = qinv-‚âÉ f (g , H‚ÇÅ , H‚ÇÇ )
    where
    private
      f : X + Y ‚Üí Y + X
      f (inl x) = inr x
      f (inr x) = inl x

      g : Y + X ‚Üí X + Y
      g (inl x) = inr x
      g (inr x) = inl x

      H‚ÇÅ : (f ‚àò g) ‚àº id
      H‚ÇÅ (inl x) = idp
      H‚ÇÅ (inr x) = idp

      H‚ÇÇ : (g ‚àò f) ‚àº id
      H‚ÇÇ (inl x) = idp
      H‚ÇÇ (inr x) = idp




  ‚âÉ-+-assoc
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {X : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{Y : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {Z : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
    ‚Üí X + (Y + Z) ‚âÉ (X + Y) + Z

  ‚âÉ-+-assoc {X = X}{Y}{Z} = qinv-‚âÉ f (g , (H‚ÇÅ , H‚ÇÇ))
    where
    private
      f : X + (Y + Z) ‚Üí (X + Y) + Z
      f (inl x) = inl (inl x)
      f (inr (inl x)) = inl (inr x)
      f (inr (inr x)) = inr x

      g : (X + Y) + Z ‚Üí X + (Y + Z)
      g (inl (inl x)) = inl x
      g (inl (inr x)) = inr (inl x)
      g (inr x) = inr (inr x)

      H‚ÇÅ : (f ‚àò g) ‚àº id
      H‚ÇÅ (inl (inl x)) = idp
      H‚ÇÅ (inl (inr x)) = idp
      H‚ÇÅ (inr x) = idp

      H‚ÇÇ : g ‚àò f ‚àº id
      H‚ÇÇ (inl x) = idp
      H‚ÇÇ (inr (inl x)) = idp
      H‚ÇÇ (inr (inr x)) = idp




  ‚âÉ-+-runit
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level}{X : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}
    ‚Üí X ‚âÉ X + (ùüò ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)

  ‚âÉ-+-runit {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ = ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}{X} = qinv-‚âÉ f (g , (H‚ÇÅ , H‚ÇÇ ))
    where
    private
      f : X ‚Üí  X + (ùüò ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)
      f  x = inl x

      g : X + (ùüò ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ) ‚Üí X
      g (inl x) = x


      H‚ÇÅ : (f ‚àò g) ‚àº id
      H‚ÇÅ (inl x) = idp

      H‚ÇÇ : (x : X) ‚Üí (g (f x)) ‚â° x
      H‚ÇÇ x = idp




  ‚âÉ-+-lunit
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level}{X : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}
    ‚Üí X ‚âÉ ùüò ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ + X

  ‚âÉ-+-lunit {‚Ñì‚ÇÇ = ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}{X} =
    X            ‚âÉ‚ü® ‚âÉ-+-runit ‚ü©
    X + ùüò ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ     ‚âÉ‚ü® ‚âÉ-+-comm ‚ü©
    (ùüò ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ) + X   ‚âÉ‚àé





  ‚âÉ-√ó-comm
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {X : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{Y : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
    ‚Üí X √ó Y ‚âÉ Y √ó X

  ‚âÉ-√ó-comm {X = X}{Y} = qinv-‚âÉ f (g , (H‚ÇÅ , H‚ÇÇ))
    where
    private
      f : X √ó Y ‚Üí Y √ó X
      f (x , y) = (y , x)

      g : Y √ó X ‚Üí X √ó Y
      g (y , x) = (x , y)

      H‚ÇÅ : (f ‚àò g) ‚àº id
      H‚ÇÅ x = idp

      H‚ÇÇ : (g ‚àò f) ‚àº id
      H‚ÇÇ x = idp




  ‚âÉ-√ó-runit
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {X : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}
    ‚Üí X ‚âÉ X √ó (ùüô ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)

  ‚âÉ-√ó-runit {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}{X = X} = qinv-‚âÉ f (g , (H‚ÇÅ , H‚ÇÇ))
    where
    private
      f : X ‚Üí X √ó ùüô ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ
      f x = (x , unit)

      g : X √ó ùüô ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Üí X
      g (x , _) = x

      H‚ÇÅ : (f ‚àò g) ‚àº id
      H‚ÇÅ x = idp

      H‚ÇÇ : (g ‚àò f) ‚àº id
      H‚ÇÇ x = idp




  ‚âÉ-√ó-lunit
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} {X : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}
    ‚Üí X ‚âÉ ùüô ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ √ó X

  ‚âÉ-√ó-lunit {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {X = X} =
    X           ‚âÉ‚ü® ‚âÉ-√ó-runit ‚ü©
    X √ó (ùüô ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)   ‚âÉ‚ü® ‚âÉ-√ó-comm ‚ü©
    (ùüô ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ) √ó X   ‚âÉ‚àé




  ‚âÉ-√ó-assoc
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {X : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{Y : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {Z : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
    ‚Üí X √ó (Y √ó Z) ‚âÉ (X √ó Y) √ó Z

  ‚âÉ-√ó-assoc {X = X}{Y}{Z} = qinv-‚âÉ f (g , (H‚ÇÅ , H‚ÇÇ))
    where
    private
      f : X √ó (Y √ó Z) ‚Üí (X √ó Y) √ó Z
      f (x , (y , z)) = ( (x , y) , z)

      g : (X √ó Y) √ó Z ‚Üí X √ó (Y √ó Z)
      g ((x , y) , z) = (x , (y , z))

      H‚ÇÅ : (f ‚àò g) ‚àº id
      H‚ÇÅ ((x , y) , z) = idp

      H‚ÇÇ : g ‚àò f ‚àº id
      H‚ÇÇ (x , (y , z)) = idp




  ‚âÉ-√ó-+-distr
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {X : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{Y : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {Z : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
    ‚Üí (X √ó (Y + Z)) ‚âÉ ((X √ó Y) + (X √ó Z))

  ‚âÉ-√ó-+-distr {X = X}{Y}{Z} = qinv-‚âÉ f (g , (H‚ÇÅ , H‚ÇÇ))
    where
    private
      f : (X √ó (Y + Z)) ‚Üí ((X √ó Y) + (X √ó Z))
      f (x , inl y) = inl (x , y)
      f (x , inr z) = inr (x , z)

      g : ((X √ó Y) + (X √ó Z)) ‚Üí (X √ó (Y + Z))
      g (inl (x , y)) = x , inl y
      g (inr (x , z)) = x , inr z

      open import CoproductIdentities
      H‚ÇÅ : (f ‚àò g) ‚àº id
      H‚ÇÅ (inl x) = ap inl (uppt x )
      H‚ÇÅ (inr x) = ap inr (uppt x)

      H‚ÇÇ : (g ‚àò f) ‚àº id
      H‚ÇÇ (p , inl x) = pair= (idp , idp)
      H‚ÇÇ (p , inr x) = pair= (idp , idp)




A type and its lifting to some universe are equivalent as types.



  lifting-equivalence
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level}
    ‚Üí (A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ)
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ (‚Üë ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ A)

  lifting-equivalence {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} A =
    quasiinverse-to-‚âÉ f (g , (Œª { (Lift a) ‚Üí idp}) , Œª {p ‚Üí idp})
    where
    f : A ‚Üí ‚Üë ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ A
    f a = Lift a

    g : A ‚Üê ‚Üë ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ A
    g (Lift a) = a




Some synomys:



  ‚âÉ-‚Üë = lifting-equivalence

{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}
open import TransportLemmas
open import EquivalenceType

open import HomotopyType
open import QuasiinverseType

open import CoproductIdentities






module SigmaEquivalence {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ : Level} (A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ) (P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ) where




  pair=Equiv
    : {v w : Œ£ A P}
    --------------------------------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí Œ£ (œÄ‚ÇÅ v == œÄ‚ÇÅ w) (Œª p ‚Üí tr (Œª a ‚Üí P a) p (œÄ‚ÇÇ v) == œÄ‚ÇÇ w) ‚âÉ (v == w)

  pair=Equiv = qinv-‚âÉ Œ£-bycomponents (Œ£-componentwise , HŒ£‚ÇÅ , HŒ£‚ÇÇ)
    where
      HŒ£‚ÇÅ : Œ£-bycomponents ‚àò Œ£-componentwise ‚àº id
      HŒ£‚ÇÅ idp = idp

      HŒ£‚ÇÇ : Œ£-componentwise ‚àò Œ£-bycomponents ‚àº id
      HŒ£‚ÇÇ (idp , idp) = idp

  private
    f : {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A} {Œ± : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ}{c‚ÇÅ : P a‚ÇÅ} {c‚ÇÇ : P a‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí {Œ≤ : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí {Œ≥ : transport P Œ≤ c‚ÇÅ == c‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí ap œÄ‚ÇÅ (pair= (Œ≤ , Œ≥)) == Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤ == Œ±
    f {Œ≤ = idp} {Œ≥ = idp} idp = idp

    g : {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A} {Œ± : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ}{c‚ÇÅ : P a‚ÇÅ} {c‚ÇÇ : P a‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí {Œ≤ : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí {Œ≥ : transport P Œ≤ c‚ÇÅ == c‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí Œ≤ == Œ± ‚Üí ap œÄ‚ÇÅ (pair= (Œ≤ , Œ≥)) == Œ±
    g {Œ≤ = idp} {Œ≥ = idp} idp = idp

    f-g : {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A} {Œ± : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ}{c‚ÇÅ : P a‚ÇÅ} {c‚ÇÇ : P a‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí {Œ≤ : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí {Œ≥ : transport P Œ≤ c‚ÇÅ == c‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí f {Œ± = Œ±}{Œ≤ = Œ≤}{Œ≥} ‚àò g {Œ± = Œ±}{Œ≤ = Œ≤} ‚àº id
    f-g {Œ≤ = idp} {Œ≥ = idp} idp = idp

    g-f : {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A} {Œ± : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ}{c‚ÇÅ : P a‚ÇÅ} {c‚ÇÇ : P a‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí {Œ≤ : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí {Œ≥ : transport P Œ≤ c‚ÇÅ == c‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí g {Œ± = Œ±}{Œ≤ = Œ≤}{Œ≥} ‚àò f {Œ± = Œ±}{Œ≤ = Œ≤}{Œ≥} ‚àº id
    g-f {Œ≤ = idp} {Œ≥ = idp} idp = idp




  ap-œÄ‚ÇÅ-pair=Equiv
    : {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A} {c‚ÇÅ : P a‚ÇÅ} {c‚ÇÇ : P a‚ÇÇ}
    ‚Üí (Œ± : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ)
    ‚Üí (Œ≥ : Œ£ (a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ) (Œª p ‚Üí c‚ÇÅ == c‚ÇÇ [ P ‚Üì p ]))
    -----------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí (ap œÄ‚ÇÅ (pair= Œ≥) == Œ±) ‚âÉ (œÄ‚ÇÅ Œ≥ == Œ±)

  ap-œÄ‚ÇÅ-pair=Equiv {a‚ÇÅ = a‚ÇÅ} Œ± (Œ≤ , Œ≥) = qinv-‚âÉ f (g , f-g , g-f)

layout: page

{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}
module _ where

open import TransportLemmas
open import ProductIdentities
open import CoproductIdentities

open import EquivalenceType

open import HomotopyType
open import HomotopyLemmas

open import HalfAdjointType
open import QuasiinverseType
open import QuasiinverseLemmas






module
  SigmaPreserves {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{C : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}{D : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
    (e : (a : A) ‚Üí C a ‚âÉ D a)
  where

  private
    f : (a : A) ‚Üí C a ‚Üí D a
    f a = lemap (e a)

    f‚Åª¬π : (a : A) ‚Üí D a ‚Üí C a
    f‚Åª¬π a = remap (e a)

    Œ± : (a : A) ‚Üí (f a) ‚àò (f‚Åª¬π a) ‚àº id
    Œ± a x = lrmap-inverse (e a)

    Œ≤ : (a : A) ‚Üí (f‚Åª¬π a) ‚àò (f a) ‚àº id
    Œ≤ a x = rlmap-inverse (e a)

    Œ£AC-to-Œ£AD :  Œ£ A C ‚Üí Œ£ A D
    Œ£AC-to-Œ£AD (a , c) = (a , (f a) c)

    Œ£AD-to-Œ£AC :  Œ£ A D ‚Üí Œ£ A C
    Œ£AD-to-Œ£AC (a , d) = (a , (f‚Åª¬π a) d)

    H‚ÇÅ : Œ£AC-to-Œ£AD ‚àò Œ£AD-to-Œ£AC ‚àº id
    H‚ÇÅ (a , d) = pair= (idp , Œ± a d)

    H‚ÇÇ : Œ£AD-to-Œ£AC ‚àò Œ£AC-to-Œ£AD ‚àº id
    H‚ÇÇ (a , c) = pair= (idp , Œ≤ a c)




  sigma-preserves
    : Œ£ A C ‚âÉ Œ£ A D

  sigma-preserves = qinv-‚âÉ Œ£AC-to-Œ£AD (Œ£AD-to-Œ£AC , H‚ÇÅ , H‚ÇÇ)

open SigmaPreserves




If  and  and , then





module SigmaPreserves-‚âÉ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
  {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} (e : B ‚âÉ A) {C : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ} where

  private
    f : B ‚Üí A
    f = lemap e

    ishaef : ishae f
    ishaef = ‚âÉ-ishae e

    f‚Åª¬π : A ‚Üí B
    f‚Åª¬π = ishae.g ishaef

    Œ± : f ‚àò f‚Åª¬π ‚àº id
    Œ± = ishae.Œµ ishaef

    Œ≤ : f‚Åª¬π ‚àò f  ‚àº id
    Œ≤ = ishae.Œ∑ ishaef

    œÑ : (b : B) ‚Üí ap f (Œ≤ b) == Œ± (f b)
    œÑ = ishae.œÑ ishaef

  Œ£AC-to-Œ£BCf : Œ£ A C ‚Üí Œ£ B (Œª b ‚Üí C (f b))
  Œ£AC-to-Œ£BCf (a , c) = f‚Åª¬π a , c'
    where
      c' : C (f (f‚Åª¬π a))
      c' = transport C ((Œ± a) ‚Åª¬π) c

  Œ£BCf-to-Œ£AC : Œ£ B (Œª b ‚Üí C (f b)) ‚Üí Œ£ A C
  Œ£BCf-to-Œ£AC (b , c') = f b , c'

  private
    H‚ÇÅ : Œ£AC-to-Œ£BCf ‚àò Œ£BCf-to-Œ£AC ‚àº id
    H‚ÇÅ (b , c') = pair= (Œ≤ b , patho)
      where
      c'' : C (f (f‚Åª¬π (f b)))
      c'' = transport C ((Œ± (f b)) ‚Åª¬π) c'

      -- patho : c'' == c' [ (C ‚àò f) ‚Üì (Œ≤ b)]
      patho : transport (Œª x ‚Üí C (f x)) (Œ≤ b) c'' == c'
      patho =
        begin
          transport (Œª x ‚Üí C (f x)) (Œ≤ b) c''
            ==‚ü® transport-family (Œ≤ b) c'' ‚ü©
          transport C (ap f (Œ≤ b)) c''
            ==‚ü® ap (Œª Œ≥ ‚Üí transport C Œ≥ c'') (œÑ b) ‚ü©
          transport C (Œ± (f b)) c''
            ==‚ü® transport-comp-h ((Œ± (f b)) ‚Åª¬π) (Œ± (f b)) c' ‚ü©
          transport C ( ((Œ± (f b)) ‚Åª¬π) ¬∑ Œ± (f b)) c'
            ==‚ü® ap (Œª Œ≥ ‚Üí transport C Œ≥ c') (¬∑-linv (Œ± (f b))) ‚ü©
          transport C idp c'
            ==‚ü®‚ü©
          c'
        ‚àé

  private
    H‚ÇÇ : Œ£BCf-to-Œ£AC ‚àò Œ£AC-to-Œ£BCf ‚àº id
    H‚ÇÇ (a , c) = pair= (Œ± a , patho)
      where
      patho : transport C (Œ± a) (transport C ((Œ± a) ‚Åª¬π) c) == c
      patho =
        begin
          transport C (Œ± a) (transport C ((Œ± a) ‚Åª¬π) c)
            ==‚ü® transport-comp-h (((Œ± a) ‚Åª¬π)) (Œ± a) c ‚ü©
          transport C ( ((Œ± a) ‚Åª¬π) ¬∑ (Œ± a) ) c
            ==‚ü® ap (Œª Œ≥ ‚Üí transport C Œ≥ c) (¬∑-linv (Œ± a)) ‚ü©
          transport C idp c
            ==‚ü®‚ü©
          c
        ‚àé




  sigma-preserves-‚âÉ
    : Œ£ A C ‚âÉ Œ£ B (Œª b ‚Üí C (f b))

  sigma-preserves-‚âÉ = qinv-‚âÉ Œ£AC-to-Œ£BCf (Œ£BCf-to-Œ£AC , H‚ÇÅ , H‚ÇÇ)

open SigmaPreserves-‚âÉ public




sigma-maps-‚âÉ
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ ‚Ñì‚ÇÑ} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {A' : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÑ} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}{B' : A' ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
  ‚Üí (Œ± : A ‚âÉ A')
  ‚Üí ((a : A) ‚Üí (B a ‚âÉ B' ((Œ± ‚àô) a)))
  ----------------------------------
  ‚Üí Œ£ A B ‚âÉ Œ£ A' B'

sigma-maps-‚âÉ {A = A}{A'}{B}{B'} Œ± Œ≤ =
  ‚âÉ-trans (sigma-preserves Œ≤) (‚âÉ-sym (sigma-preserves-‚âÉ Œ±))

Equivalence with Pi type



module PiPreserves {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ : Level} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{C : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}{D : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
    (e : (a : A) ‚Üí (C a ‚âÉ D a)) where

  private
    f : (a : A) ‚Üí C a ‚Üí D a
    f a = lemap (e a)

    f‚Åª¬π : (a : A) ‚Üí D a ‚Üí C a
    f‚Åª¬π a = remap (e a)

    Œ± : (a : A) ‚Üí (f a) ‚àò (f‚Åª¬π a) ‚àº id
    Œ± a x = lrmap-inverse (e a)

    Œ≤ : (a : A) ‚Üí (f‚Åª¬π a) ‚àò (f a) ‚àº id
    Œ≤ a x = rlmap-inverse (e a)

    Œ†AC‚ÜíŒ†AD : Œ† A C ‚Üí Œ† A D
    Œ†AC‚ÜíŒ†AD p = Œª a ‚Üí (f a) (p a)

    Œ†AD‚ÜíŒ†AC : Œ† A D ‚Üí Œ† A C
    Œ†AD‚ÜíŒ†AC p = Œª a ‚Üí (f‚Åª¬π a) (p a)

    H‚ÇÅ : Œ†AC‚ÜíŒ†AD ‚àò Œ†AD‚ÜíŒ†AC ‚àº id
    H‚ÇÅ p =
      begin
        (Œ†AC‚ÜíŒ†AD ‚àò Œ†AD‚ÜíŒ†AC) p
          ==‚ü® idp ‚ü©
        Œ†AC‚ÜíŒ†AD (Œª a ‚Üí (f‚Åª¬π a) (p a))
          ==‚ü® idp ‚ü©
        (Œª aa ‚Üí (f aa) (f‚Åª¬π aa (p aa)))
          ==‚ü® funext (Œª x ‚Üí Œ± x (p x)) ‚ü©
        (Œª aa ‚Üí p aa)
      ‚àé

    H‚ÇÇ : Œ†AD‚ÜíŒ†AC ‚àò Œ†AC‚ÜíŒ†AD ‚àº id
    H‚ÇÇ p =
      begin
        (Œ†AD‚ÜíŒ†AC ‚àò Œ†AC‚ÜíŒ†AD) p
          ==‚ü® idp ‚ü©
        Œ†AD‚ÜíŒ†AC (Œª a ‚Üí (f a) (p a))
          ==‚ü® idp ‚ü©
        (Œª aa ‚Üí (f‚Åª¬π aa) (f aa (p aa)))
          ==‚ü® funext (Œª x ‚Üí Œ≤ x (p x)) ‚ü©
        (Œª aa ‚Üí p aa)
      ‚àé




  -- Lem.
  pi-equivalence
    : Œ† A C ‚âÉ Œ† A D -- by (e : (a : A) ‚Üí (C a ‚âÉ D a))

  pi-equivalence = qinv-‚âÉ Œ†AC‚ÜíŒ†AD (Œ†AD‚ÜíŒ†AC , H‚ÇÅ , H‚ÇÇ)

-- open PiPreserves public
